loans.name: Shamkha

texts.en:
Shamkha is a 63-year-old widow who still has a son and a daughter living with her in the same house.

Because of her older age and the fact that she is an illiterate woman, there aren’t many opportunities for her to work, so she opened a small store four years ago where she sells snacks for kids, and through the years she added other food products like pasta, rice, sugar, etc.

Now Shamkha has applied for this loan in order to add more food products to attract more customers so she can keep on being able to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to add more food products to the store.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, age 45, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Xuan and her husband run a clothes-selling business. Most of her family's income depends upon the sale of clothes. Xuan established her shop in 2001. 

Xuan would like to take a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of clothing to sell from her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase a greater range and quantity of clothing to sell from her shop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been practicing dairy farming for the last eight years in the Magina area of Limuru town. She is 43 years old and married to Julius. They have been blessed with three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to boost her dairy farming by setting up a a milk distributing center. 

In the future, Margaret hopes to practice large-scale dairy farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to boost her dairy farming by setting up a milk distributing centre.

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh a 23-year-old divorced lady who is currently living with her parents. 

She recently started a small retail business selling blankets and she wants to expand it to include clothes too. But since her basic capital is still small she wants to work on increasing it then move to the next stage which is having a small separate retail shop. 

To be able to do that she has applied for this loan to buy more blankets and winter clothes since the winter season has started now.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and winter clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married, 24 years old, and he describes himself as a hardworking business man. He has been charging batteries and selling car batteries for the past year to make a living. James has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he plans to renovate his business premises and also become successful in his business. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy more batteries for resale.

loans.use: To buy batteries.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Twimpara B Group

texts.fr:
Alfred fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane Twimpara B. Il a 30 ans et il est marié  avec 3 enfants de 4 mois à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Afred est cultivateur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques (N.P.K. et Urée) pour son agriculture. 

Dans les prochaines années, Alfred voudrait être riche. Avec les profits, Alfred prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants et les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Alfred is part of the Tuzamurane Twimpara B group. He is 30 years old and is married with three children from four months to eight-years-old, of whom one is in school. He completed six years of primary school.

Alfred is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilisers (N-P-K and urea) for his farming.

In the coming years, Alfred would like to be rich. With the profits, Alfred plans to pay the school fees for his children and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilisers (N-P-K and urea) for his farming

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Eva is peddling & selling banana cue & sweet potato cue (these are deep-fried and covered with caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. 

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of five children, two of whom are minors and still in school. She is herself is 50 and has 25 years in active farming. She currently produces carrots, potatoes, and cabbages. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank to mitigate the great losses in farming due to inadequate rainfall. She is optimistic the water supply will earn her enough income to educate her last two children. 

She sees recurrent crop failure occasioned by inadequate rainfall as her major challenge.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is married and lives with his wife and two children in H. Chi Minh City. His wife washes clothes to earn an income to support the family. Thanh is 48 years old.

Thanh earns money by buying and selling old electrical products and vehicles. He also sells drinking water at his shop. Thanh intends to take a loan to buy a a greater range and quantity of spare-parts to meet his customers' needs. He hopes that this will enable him to better serve his customers and attract new customers. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare-parts for electrical products and vehicles to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old man; who recently got married. He helps his mother making pickles like olives and cucumber pickles and different types of spices and seasonings such as thyme and sumac, then packs them for sale.

Mohammad is now applying for a loan to buy more ingredients that are need to make more types of pickles and spices, so they can distribute to other food markets and shops.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients that are need to make pickles and spices.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is a hardworking business woman aged 29. She is married and blessed with one child. She has been operating a business selling clothes for the past two years to support her family. She also runs a cereal shop to supplement her income. She has employed one person to help her in the business. Jacklyne has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 43-year-old woman who has six sons and daughters. She used to make yogurt and cheese for her family, but recently, so she can help her husband support their big family, she started to make a larger amount of yogurt and cheese for sale.

Jawad now buys milk to make yogurt and cheese, then packs them in special packaging and sells them. Now she has applied for a loan to buy more milk and new equipment that will help her make dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more milk and new equipment for making cheese.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Imelda has a shop that sells firewood & green bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of bananas & firewood to sell.
Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas &  firewood to sell

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.es: La señora Nilfa vive en la zona Guapuru, su casa es propia la cual se encuentra a nombre de ella y su esposo,  la cliente se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, actualmente vive con su esposo y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el crédito esta destinado a la compra  para de material de construcción de cemento para la refacción de su vivienda mas propiamente para el vaciado del piso de su patio ya que en la actualidad se encuentra lleno de tierra, gracias al esfuerzo de su negocio y el apoyo de su esposo la vivienda se encuentra en proceso de construcción y agradece también a la institución ya que hará realidad su deseo el de ver su casita terminada.
texts.en: Nilfa lives in the Guapuru zone and owns her own home which is in her name and the name of her husband.  She works selling second hand clothes in different markets in the city.  Currently she lives with her husband and school aged children.  The credit is going to be used to purchase cement construction materials for the refurbishment of her home, or more specifically for the excavating and cementing of the floor of her patio since currently it is full of dirt.  Thanks to the efforts of her business and the support of her husband their home is in the process of construction and Nilfa thanks Kiva and its field partners since it will make her dream of finishing her home a reality.

loans.use: to purchase cement construction materials for the refurbishment of her home.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is married and blessed with one child who is in school. For the past four years, she has been running a beauty salon to bring up her family. She is also an employer. Winnie has employed two people to assist her in the business. Her potential customers are the local residents. She is requesting a loan of 23,995 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, she wants to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri is a 29 year-old married man with a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi M. City. 

Tri owns a business selling decorative plants and growing and selling orchids. Tri would like to take a loan to expand his current business and buy a greater range and quantity of plants and orchids to grow and sell during the coming holiday season.

Tri hopes this loan will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater range and quantity of plants and orchids to grow and sell during the coming holiday season.

loans.name: Kawkab

texts.en:
Kawkab is a 53-year-old mother of seven sons and daughters. Five of them have gotten married already.

Her son Sulaiman has a small cafeteria shop located in a very active area in Al Zarqa where he serves hot drinks and soft drinks beside sweets and biscuits. Most of his customers are taxi and bus drivers or workers who are looking for fast cheap food to eat either as breakfast or lunch.

Kawkab helps her son Sulaiman by preparing the sweets at home and sending them with him on a daily basis. She also makes special orders for other customers. Now Kawkab wants to expand by distributing the sweets she makes to more areas in Al Zarqa and selling them in more sweets shops, but to do that she needs to make a larger quantity of sweets, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

Because Kawkab is a conservative person, she asked her son Sulaiman to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making sweets.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en: Ephantus is a hardworking business man aged 30. He is married and blessed with two children and one of them is in school. He has been running a butcher shop for the last six years to support his family. He also operates a van transport business to increase his income. He has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since Ephantus joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.name: Aldin

texts.en:
Aldin is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Aldin has a shop that sells canned goods, bananas & vegetables. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy coconuts, bananas & vegetables.
Aldin has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Aldin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, bananas & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines with her two children. She is separated from her husband and supports her family by running a shop where she sells beauty items from Natasha and Avon. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2008 and is committed to continually improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a focused business man aged 30. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He has been running a carpentry business for the last two years to support his family. He has employed three people to assist him to manage the business. James has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber and seat covers.

loans.use: To buy timber and seat covers.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and nine children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling firewood. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more firewood to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008 and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Areen

texts.en:
Areen is a 29-year-old mother of three daughters and one son. She is married to Ayman who works as a driver.

Areen has been making fake flowers and plants for the last four years and sells them as decorations whether to companies or private houses. She also makes baskets and decorates trays for special events.

Now she has applied for a loan to buy more materials that are needed to make the items she sells so she can make more profit and open a special store to sell different types of decoration pieces. 

Because Areen is a conservative person, she asked her husband Ayman to be in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making fake flowers and decorating baskets.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en: Zadock is a single man aged 31. He describes himself as a hardworking business man. For the last one year, he has been selling ornaments such as necklaces and earrings to make a living. He also does mobile phone repairs to supplement his income. Zadock has employed one person to assist him in the business. In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy earrings and necklaces for resale.

loans.use: To buy earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Luz Katherine

texts.es: La señora Luz es una cliente nueva en la institución vino por referencias de un familiar que tuvo un crédito en la institución ya cancelado se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensión por un mercado el crédito esta destinado a la compra de sillas, mesas, vajillas un televisor de 21 pulgadas un aparato de radio y algunos utensilios para mejorar la calidad en el servicio y ampliar su negocio. Tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar y vive con su esposo en la casa de sus papas en la zona de Llojeta, es un apersona joven y trabajadora su deseo es ampliar su restaurante y dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes .
texts.en:
Señora Luz is a new client for the institution.  She came through the referral of a relative, who obtained a loan from the institution which has already been paid back.

Luz works preparing meals in a boarding-house a market.  This loan will be used for purchasing chairs, tables, dishes, a 21 inch TV, a radio, and several utensils for improving the quality of her service and expanding her business.

She has one school-age son, and lives with her husband in his parents' home in the Llojeta area.  She is a young, hard-working woman, whose wish is to expand her restaurant and provide better comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and other things to expand her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kitale, Western Kenya with her husband and four children, all of whom are in school. She has been a farmer for the last eight years,  producing milk and maize for sale in a local market. She is applying for a loan for 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorcycle, which she plans to use to go into the transportation business. This motorcycle will also allow her to get her own goods to market more quickly and efficiently. Her biggest challenge is diseases which occasionally affect her animals.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in the Philippines. Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  rice per kilogram, which she has been doing for five years. 

Teresita is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and sacks of rice. Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines with her two children. She is a widow who supports her family by selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for the last two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nzomo

texts.en: Nzomo is a hardworking business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. He has been running a retail shop business for the last five years to support his family. He also operates a motorbike transport business to supplement his income. He has employed one person to assist him in the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, salt and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and rice.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is married and blessed with four children all of whom attend school. He has been running a grocery business to support his family. He also sells peanuts to supplement his income. His potential customers are those pass by. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. In the next five years he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old, separated, and has nine children. She lives in the Philippines. Vilma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages, which she has had for five years. 

Vilma is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Neddy

texts.en:
Neddy is 51 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom attend school.  She has been practicing mixed farming for 16 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans, and vegetables for the local market.  She also sells second-hand clothes for additional income.

Neddy is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry birds and expand her farming into the poultry business. The venture into poultry will diversify her business and provide additional income to meet the daily needs for her family. She notes that poultry diseases are common but it remains a challenge that must be faced owing to the gains expected. She advocates for the expansion of Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Abahuje Cogiriru Ya Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Papias fait partie du groupe Abahuje Cogiriru ya Rhh. Il a 39 ans et il est marié  avec 4 enfants de 4 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Papias est cultivateur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques (N.P.K. et Urée) pour son agriculture et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Dans les prochaines années, Papias voudrait être grossiste. Avec les profits, Papias prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Papias is a member of the Abahuje Cogiriru ya Rhh Group.  He is 39 years old and a married father of four children from 4 to 12 years old, two of whom are in school.  He has six years of primary education.  

Papias is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use this loan to buy chemical fertilizer (N.P.K. and Urea) for his agriculture and to pay for the cost of labour.  

In the coming years, Papias would like to be a wholesaler.  With the profits, Papias plans to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer (N.P.K. and Urea) for farming and pay the cost of labour.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en: Annastasia is a single woman aged 34. For the last two years, she has been selling clothes and shoes to make a living. She is also employed. In the next five years she plans to establish a wholesale business. Annastasia is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet for her business. She hopes to grow her clientele so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: To open another outlet for her business.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling rice, and is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more rice to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Esmeralda has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. Esmeralda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jemimmah

texts.en: Jemimmah is a married woman aged 38. For the last two years she has been running a grocery business where she sell fruits, vegetable and tomatoes to make a living. Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she is able to retain her business because of her good reputation. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet for her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: To open another outlet for her business.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry has been farming for five years. She currently produces maize, beans, and milk for the local markets in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya. She currently employs two farmhands. Terry is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 5.

Terry has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry and add poultry farming to the list of her farming activities. She says this will help her diversify her farming trade and provide her family with basic needs.

Terry recognizes that the high cost of feeds and poultry diseases are the prominent challenges to be faced.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a tailoring machine. 

She wants to establish another business selling bicycle spare parts. With the 20,000 KES loan, she will purchase bicycle spare parts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking business woman aged 33. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last five years to bring up her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has employed two people to assist her in the business. Joyce has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Julieta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 36 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Philippines. Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages, which she has had for five years. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages. Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married and blessed with one child who is in school. She has been running a boutique to support her family. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: La señora María es cliente nueva de la institución ella es de nacionalidad Chilena pero esta radicando en Bolivia desde hace diez años  ella tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando a los cuales los esta haciendo educar sola ya que esta separada de su esposo,  la Sra.  María se dedica  ala venta de ropa la cual trae de chile cada dos meses ella esta viviendo en la zona de Irpavi II en una casa en alquiler esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería por las fiestas de fin de año para traer ropa de temporada ella la comercializa entre sus amigas y mamas del colegio de sus hijos, es una persona muy amable y dinámica, se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Señora María is a new client for the institution.  She is a Chilean national, but has been living in Bolivia for the last ten years.  She has three children who attend school.  She is ensuring their education on her own, as she is separated from her husband.

Señora María works selling clothes that she brings over from Chile every other month.  She lives in the Irpavi area in a rented home.  She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise for the year-end festivals, so that she can get seasonal clothing.  She sells to her friends and to the moms of her children's school-friends.

She is a very friendly and dynamic woman, who is grateful for the trust being given to her through provision of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Buenadilla

texts.en:
Buenadilla is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Buenadilla has a shop that provides tinsmith services. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for her tinsmithing business.
Buenadilla became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Buenadilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for tinsmithing

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been in active farming in her home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya for 24 solid years and currently still makes deliveries of milk,  potatoes, beans, cabbage, and carrots to the local market.

Margaret has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit on her farm. She says feeding of dairy cows has become very expensive and the unit will help manage the animals better. She intends to use the gains made in farming to educate her children.

She laments the high costs of feed and low prices for produce in the market.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Philippines. Gina is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver, which she has been doing for three years. 

Gina is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and tools for maintenance.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a single man aged 22. He describes himself as a hardworking business man. He has been selling shoes to make a living. He also does farming to supplement his income. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Martin is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of shoes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his shoes stock for resale.

loans.name: Fatiyah

texts.en:
Fatiya is single and has four children who attend school. She lives in a rented house in Kampala, Uganda and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. 

Fatiya owns a food stall selling bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. 

Fatiya is requesting a loan for  600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy green banana, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to own a fully stocked food stall, to start growing some foodstuffs, and to educate her children up to university level. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Lilia has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy clothes to sell.
Lilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother of four. All of her children are adults save for the last born. She is 47 years old and has been in farming for 20 solid years. Her farm now produces cabbage, carrots, potatoes, and milk for the local market.

Susan made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to buy poultry for her farm and diversify her farming business. She says she will use the income to educate her children and feed her family. 

She laments of pests and other animal diseases, which result in great losses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Tuzamurane Uruhuri Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Fidele fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane Uruhuri Rhh. Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec un enfant de 9 ans, qui est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire.

Fidele est cultivateur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques (N.P.K. et Urée) pour son agriculture et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Avec les profits, Fidele prévoit de payer des frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Fidele is part of the group Tuzamurane Uruhuri Rhh. He is 43 years old, married, and has a 9-year-old child who attends school. He himself has had 4 years of primary school. 

Fidele is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer (N.P.K. and urea) for farming and to pay a field worker.

With the profits, Fidele plans to pay medical fees for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium and urea) for farming and to pay a field worker.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yeni sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Yeni  cumplió 32 años y sigue trabajando en la venta de materiales. Yeni también trabajando brindar servicios de masajes.  Yeni con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y obtuvo buenas utilidades la cual la invirtió en la casta familiar. 
 
Yeni requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, cemento y otras cosas más. 
 
Yeni se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yeni continues to participate in the Ricchary Runa communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Yeni is now 32 years old, and she continues to work selling materials.  Yeni also works by offering massage services.

Yeni’s previous loan went very well for her, and she got good profits, which she used for the family’s basic needs.

Yeni needs the loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and more.

Yeni is grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the time line.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and more.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Elvira has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and trout. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Myrlyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Myrlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 47 años, es madre soltera. Cuida de su hijo Jeanpier en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Su principal característica es su vitalidad y ganas por salir adelante. Los años no pasan en ella, pues necesita tener todas las fuerzas para sacar adelante a su hijo, que es un niño con muchas habilidades. Por ello desea brindarle una buena educación; su principal actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, donde ofrece dulces, bebidas y comida rápida. Le va muy bien en su trabajo tanto así que ahora desea abrir un restaurante a la vez. Todo esto gracias al lugar donde queda su fuente de soda, que es estratégico por la afluencia de personas que ya conocen de la buena sazón que tiene. Ahora ella desea sacar el máximo provecho a las fiestas navideñas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Adela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Adela, who 47 years of age is a single mother. She looks after her son Jeanpier at her parents’ house, situated in the district of Tambo. Her main characteristic is her vitality and her yearning to come out ahead. The years don’t pass her by as she needs to give her son a good start in life given that he is a very talented child. Because of this, she wants to provide him with a good education; her primary activity is the sale of basic products from her grocery store, where she sells sweets, drinks and quick food. 

Her work is going very well, so much so that she now wants to open a restaurant. All this is thanks to the place where she has set up her soda foundation as it is a strategic location due to the amount of people who know how tasty it is. Now she wishes to take full advantage of the festive season (Christmas).

She belongs to the community bank “Rompiendo Fronteras” (“Breaking Boundaries”) and this is their sixth loan with MFP, where they await your contribution to continue pursuing their goals. Adela promises to once more pay off her loan repayments. She also likes being part of a communal bank as all of its members are responsible and caring people. Adela will use the money received for the purchase of basic products for her store.

loans.use: purchase of basic products for her store.

loans.name: Eligia

texts.en:
Eligia is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Eligia has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for 35 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy cloths and materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Eligia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Eligia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloths and materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Arturo sigue trabajando brindando servicio de transportes de mudanza en su propio camión. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Arturo requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro y para la construcción de su casa. 
 
Arturo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Arturo participates in the “Ricchary  Runa” communal bank with Asociación  Arariwa, in the city of Cusco.  Currently Arturo is working providing moving services with his own truck.  He has been working in this business for several years, and it has been going very well for him.

Arturo is requesting the loan to conduct maintenance on his vehicle and for construction for his home.

Arturo is grateful for the opportunity being provided to him by this means, and also commits to comply with the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance on his vehicle and do some construction on his home.

loans.name: Elizabeth Rita

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es cliente antigua de la institución ella vive en la zona de Villa Pabón en anticrético tiene un hijito el cual esta en edad escolar antes la Sra. Elizabeth se dedicaba a la venta de carteras, con lo cual no le fue bien en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de sándwich en la puerta de un  campo deportivo  de lunes  a domingo, ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus sándwich y fruta, azúcar  para la elaboración de los jugos, la Sra. tiene mucha clientela ya que les atiende con amabilidad, también le va muy bien con la venta de jugos, el deseo de la Sra. es el ver un día a su hijo profesional y una persona de bien, La Sra. Elizabeth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is an old client of our institution who lives in the Villa Pabon zone with an 'anticretico' (a pre-paid rental contract common in Bolivia). She has a young son of school age. In the past, Elizabeth sold wallets but that didn't go well. At present, she sells sandwiches at the entrance to a sports field, Monday through Sunday.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making sandwiches, plus fruit and sugar for preparing juices. She has many customers since she attends them amiably. Selling juices is also going very well.

Elizabeth's desire is one day to see her son become a professional and a good person. She is a very hard working woman and very grateful for this offer of help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing sandwiches and juices to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie  lives in West Point  and is 37 years old. She is single  and has four children aged 1 to 8. They live at home and three are presently in school. For the past  few years  she has been selling soft drinks. She enjoys  the ways customers  flow in to her business. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks  for her  business. She plans to build her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks  for her  business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 28 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compaña de su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Jairo y Kiara a los que cuida en su casa propia; ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. El arte lo lleva en la sangre, desde niña aprendió a tejer, su madre le enseño todas las técnicas del tejido. Por eso Cecilia convirtió a su mejor pasatiempo en su medio de vida. El tejido de gorras, chompas y conjuntos de vestir enteros, es su actividad económica, todos los días recibe a sus clientes quienes le hace pedidos, pues conocen de su destreza. Además la quieren mucho; pues ella vive sola con sus hijos; ya que su esposo trabaja en una mina como obrero. Su trabajo lo absorbe tanto que solo viaja una vez por mes a visitarlos; “es el esfuerzo que tiene que realizar para brindarnos una mejor calidad de vida”, afirma con optimismo. Por ello espera que dentro de muy poco pueda ampliar su negocio, generar buenas ganancias y de esa manera tener a su familia unida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Cecilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madejas de lana para sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 28, is a fighter.  She lives with her husband and two children, Jairo and Kiara, for whom she cares in her own home located in the Chilca district.

Art is in her blood.  She learned to knit as a little girl.  Her mother taught her all the techniques of knitting.  This is why Cecilia converted her favorite pastime into her means of support.

Knitting caps, sweaters, and entire outfits is her job.  Every day she receives her customers, who order from her since they know her skill.  They also love her very much.

Cecilia lives alone with her children since her husband works as a mine laborer.  Her work takes up so much time that she travels only once a month to visit him.  "It's the effort he has to make to offer us a better quality of life," she affirms optimistically.  This is why she hopes that soon she can expand her business and generate good profits, and in this way have her family together.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  She also is pleased to be part of her bank, because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

When she receives her support, Cecilia will invest the requested money in buying skeins of wool for her knitting.

loans.use: to buy skeins of wool.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Daniel sigue brindando servicio de transportes de mudanza y brindando servicio de taxi en su propio carro. Ya 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Daniel paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Daniel requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro.  

Daniel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daniel continues to participate in the Ricchary Runa communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Daniel continues to provide moving transportation service and taxi service in his own car.  He has had this business for 25 years, and it is going very well for him.

Daniel makes his payments punctually, and he had no problem with the previous loan.  To the contrary, it went very well for him.

Daniel needs the loan for maintenance on his car.

Daniel is grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan, and he promises to make his payments according to the time line.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance.

loans.name: Duo Sembrando Con Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO SEMBRANDO CON AMOR
ROGELIA:la lider del grupo, Es una persona trabajadora que apoya a su esposo con un negocio, y que los a ayudado a salir adelante, se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras un producto que lo compran en los pueblos cercanos y lo traen a vender en la capital, también parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos hecho a mano, bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos que necesitan el apoyo de sus padres para ir a la escuela, por eso  ella necesita un capital para ampliar mas su negocio y para comprar frutas y verduras,como aguacates tomates,y granadias,etc  y así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelia is the leader of the group Duo Sembrando Con Amor. She is hard-working and supports her husband with their business, which has helped them to get ahead. They buy and sell fruit and vegetables for a living, which they purchase in the nearby villages and take to sell in the capital. Some of their time is also dedicated to making typical hand made fabrics. 

They are responsible for their children, who need their parents' support to go to school. This means that Rogelia needs some capital to further expand her business and to buy fruit and vegetables such as avocados, tomatoes and pomegranate. In this way, they can help their family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, D. 28 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía D. su mamá Gloria y su hermano Henry; en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Los libertadores D. huari.  Hace algunos años, tomó L. responsabilidad D. su hogar; por ello abrió un pequeño grifo, donD. venD. petróleo a los carros que visitan L. zona constantemente. Le va muy bien en su negocio tanto así que pudo ahorrar lo necesario para abrir una tienda D. comestibles, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad a los pobladores D. su zona. Además D. dedicarse a L. ganadería, ya tiene 6 vacas y 40 ovejas a las que enseba para luego venderlas a buen precio. Cuenta que, cuando sus vacas dan cría, venD. L. leche que produce a los ganaderos y vecinos, quienes le compran cada año. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo, comprando diversos productos. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Huari” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Efraín D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. varios galones D. petróleo y productos D. primera necesidad para su tienda D. comestibles.
texts.en:
Efraín, age 28, is a hard-working young man.  He lives with his mother, Gloria, and his brother, Henry.  They live in their own house in the rural community of Los Liberatores D. Huari.

Some years ago he took the responsibility for his household.  To do so he opened a small gas station where he sells petroleum to the cars that constantly visit the area.  The business is going very well. It is going so well that he was able to save what he needed to open a grocery store where he sells basic needs products to the people in his zone.

He also devotes himself to livestock.  He has 6 cows and 40 sheep that he fattens and later sells for a good price.  He says that when the cows give birth he sells the milk that is produced to the cattle-dealers and neighbors who buy from him every year.

He now wishes to improve his business and to expand it by purchasing diverse products.  He is a member of the Huari communal bank, and this is his third loan with MFP.  He hopes for your collaboration so that he will be able to solidify his planes.  He pledges to make his payments.  Also, he is grateful to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support Efraín will use the requested loan to buy several gallons of petroleum and basic needs products for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store and to buy gallons of petroleum.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Carmen Rosa sigue dedicándose a brindar servicio de sastrería en unos de los centros comercial más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Carmen Rosa paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de sastrería como por ejemplo telas, hilos y otras cosas más.
 
Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa continues participating in the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She also continues working as a tailor in one of the most popular shopping centers in Cusco. She has worked in this business for several years and she is doing very well.

Carmen Rosa makes her payments on time and had no problems with a previous loan. In fact, that loan was promptly and fully repaid.

Carmen Rosa needs a new loan to buy tailoring material such as fabric, thread and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity provided in this way and is committed to making all of her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material such as fabric, thread and other items.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Walter B. trabaja y vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad, el es chófer de una mototaxi, escogió este tipo de negocio porque le gusta transportar gente y porque le sale rentable. Gana aproximadamente S/. 279 nuevos soles semanales, el señor es un hombre trabajador y muy luchador con muchas ganas de sacar a su familia adelante.  

Walter empezó su negocio en el año 2005 en el área de transporte, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 6 horas y 6 días a la semana, recibiendo ayuda de su amigo, gracias al crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en pagar sus primeras cuotas de su propia moto, también su crédito le permite a Walter en pensar en el futuro , el sueña con tener su propia empresa de transporte de mototaxi y con tener un auto propio a un mediano plazo.  Su asesor de crédito piensa que es un excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Walter B. works and lives in the city of Ica. He is single, 21 years of age and works as a motorcycle taxi chauffeur. He chose this type of business because he enjoys transporting people and because it is profitable. He earns approximately 279 nuevos soles a week. He is a very hardworking man who very much wants to help his family get ahead.

Walter started his business in the transportation area in the year 2005. He works about six hours a day,  six days a week, receiving help from his friend. Thanks to the loan he will receive, he will be able to make his first payments on his own motorcycle. The loan will also enable Walter to think of the future. He dreams of having his own motorcycle taxi business and of owning his own automobile in the not too distant future. His credit counselor believes he is an excellent client and that he will make his payments promptly.

loans.use: to make some payments on the motorcycle taxi he acquired.

loans.name: Hilario Jose

texts.es: Hilario José inicio un hace un año un negocio de venta de comida y ofrece platillos como gallo pinto, carnes, tajaditas, queso frito, empanadas entre otros su actividad está ubicada en su casa de habitación, todos los días va a vender sus productos, pues para él es muy importante mejorar su negocio. Trabaja desde las de las 6 de la mañana que tiene que salir en busca de los granos básicos para la elaboración de sus platillos hasta las 6 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar, bolsas, verduras, frijoles, cubiertos entre otros.  En el futuro quiere ampliar su local y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Hilario José started a business a year ago selling food and offering dishes like gallo pinto (rice and beans), beef, tajaditas (fried plantain), fried cheese and empanadas (turnovers) among other items. His business is located in his home. He works every day selling his products since it is very important for him to improve his business. He works from 6 in the morning, when he has to go in search of the basic ingredients used in making his dishes, until 6 in the evening. He wants to use the loan to buy merchandise such as oil, rice, sugar, bags, vegetables, beans and place settings, among other products. In the future he wants to expand his premises and make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, bags, vegetables, beans, place settings among other products.

loans.name: Yhant Kent

texts.es: El señor Yhant vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Ica, el es un hombre soltero de 33 años de edad, el es chófer de una mototaxi, le gusta este tipo de trabajo porque su Tío le enseño, a su vez le gusta tratar con la gente y transportarla, porque le parece rentable, gana un promedio de S/. 210 nuevos soles semanales, el señor es un hombre trabajador y luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  El señor Yhant empezó su negocio en el año 2001 en el área de transporte, diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 7 días a la semana recibiendo ayuda de su tío, con el préstamo que se le va a otorgar piensa pagar algunas letras de una mototaxi que se compro, también este crédito le permite pensar en el futuro y sueña con tener una empresa de transporte y con tener un propio auto, su asesor de crédito piensa que es un excelente cliente y que pagará sus cuotas puntuales.
texts.en:
Sr. Yhant lives and works in the town of Ica. He is single, 33 years old, and drives a motorcycle taxi. He enjoys the work as his uncle taught him the trade and because he likes dealing with and transporting the public. He earns an average of S/. 210 per week.

Mariotali is a hardworking, enterprising person who is very eager to get ahead. He began the business in 2001 and works about ten hours per day, seven days a week. His uncle helps him also. 

With the loan, Yhant plans to make some repayments on the taxi he bought. He is also thinking of the future; he would like to have his own transportation business and a vehicle of his own.

Mariotali’s loan adviser believes him to be an excellent candidate who will make his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to make some repayments on his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more  slippers  for her  business.

loans.name: Komba Denis' Group

texts.en:
We are pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu City in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 6,100,000 SLL from Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner micro-finance institution (MFI) based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. With the help of this loan they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Tamba is the leader of this group of teachers. The 52-year-old Tamba lives in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Tamba has been a professional teacher for 28 years now. Tamba has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
DJIBRIL AGE 43 ANS HABITE DANS REGION DU SUD AU SENEGAL,MARIE AVEC 3 ENFANTS SONT TOUS A L'ECOLE , LES DEUX PLUS GRANDS SONT AUX COLLEGE ET LE PLUS A L'ECOLE PRIMAIRE.AVEC CE CREDIT ' IL ACHETE DES POUSSINS POUR RENFORCER SON POULAILLER.
DJIBRIL A TRAVAILLE DANS L'AVICULTURE DEPUIS SON ENFANCE CAR C'EST UN METIER QU'IL A TROUVE DANS LA FAMILLE AVANT SA NAISSANCE.DJIBRIL ACHETE DES POUSSINS A DAKAR ET LES NOURRIE PUIS REVENDRE A L'AGE 45 A 60 JOURS A 3500F OU 4000F A L'AGE DE 45 A 60 JOURS.AVEC L'AVICULTURE,DJIBRIL ASSURE TOUTES LES CHARGES DE LA FAMILLE
DJIBRIL DANS L'AVENIR , IL VEUT SON ACTIVITE , DIVERSIFIER SES PROJETS.
texts.en:
Djibril, aged 43, lives in the south of Sénégal.  He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. The two older children are in middle school and the youngest is in primary school.  With his loan, he will buy chicks to add to his chicken coop.  

Djibril has raised poultry from childhood because his family has been doing this work since before he was born.  Djibril buys his chicks in Dakar, feeds them, then resells them when they are 45 to 60 days old for 3500 to 4000F.  With his poultry business, Djibril meets all the needs of his family.  

In the future, he would like to diversify his work.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide maintenance to his mototaxi

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, de 33 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Maurita, su esposa desde hace 3 meses. Aún no tienen hijos, pero viven juntos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Los libertadores de Huari. Aún está conformando su familia, desea muy pronto tener su primer hijo. Por ello trabaja muy duro. Su principal actividad es la ganadería, pues cuida de sus vacas, ovejas y alpacas que cría. Según cuenta le gusta mucho esa actividad, pues es rentable ya que cría animales de calidad. Paralelo a esa actividad, también trabaja mejorando las carreteras de su zona, ahí recibe un sueldo de parte del gobierno local. Con todos esos ingresos está seguro que comenzará a ahorrar para mejorar su casa, que es rústica y abrir un negocio para que su esposa administre. Con ello espera procrear a su primer hijo y brindarle todo lo necesario. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Huari” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nelson de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 ovejas que cuesta un promedio de 100 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Nelson, age 33, is a hardworking gentleman. He lives with Maurita, his wife of three months. They have no children yet and live in their own home in the village of Los Libertadores de Huari. Nelson is still starting his family and wants to have a child very soon. It is for this reason that he works very hard. His main business activity is raising livestock such as cows, sheep, and alpacas. He says that he greatly enjoys this activity because producing quality animals is profitable. In addition to this business, he also does repair work on the roads in his district and receives a salary from the local government. With all of the income that he earns, Nelson is starting to save so that he can make improvements to his rustic house. He also wants to start a business that his wife can manage. When he has his first child, he hopes to have everything that is necessary.

Nelson is a member of the Communal Bank “Huari” and will be receiving his first loan from MFP. He hopes that the assistance given to him will help him to follow through with his plans. Nelson promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. With the money he requested, Nelson will invest in the purchase of 10 sheep that have an average cost of 100 PEN per head.

loans.use: to buy 10 heads of sheep.

loans.name: Marlene Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Marlene se dedica a la venta de mariscos en general como por ejemplo, pulpo, almejas, langostinos, etc. Estos productos provienen del mar de los países de Chile y Perú, ya que Bolivia no cuenta con salida al mar. Las ventas las realiza  a los restaurantes, marisquerías, cevicheras de ciudad de La Paz y el Alto de Bolivia, la señora Marlene no cuenta con hijos pero es muy trabajadora y piensa en el futuro compra su casa propia y así tener algún patrimonio que ofrecer a futuros hijos, con el dinero del credito comprara mariscos, para la entrega de pedidos, su sueño es el llegar a tener un restaurant que venda productos del mar y hacer posible que  los pobladores de La Paz y Bolivia degusten de estos exquisitos mariscos, Marlene es una persona joven  emprendedora con ganas de superación, se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marlene sells varied seafood such as octopus, clams, prawns, etc.  These products are imported from Chile and Perú, since Bolivia has no sea coast. She sells to restaurants, seafood and ceviche establishments in La Paz and el Alto de Bolivia.  Marlene does not have children, and is very hard-working and hopes in the future to buy her own house and have some savings for an eventual family.  With this credit she plans to buy seafood to satisfy customer orders.  She dreams of one day owning a restaurant to sell her seafood products for residents of La Paz and Bolivia to enjoy.  Marlene is dedicated worker and is very grateful for the support given by microcredit.

loans.use: to buy seafood (octopus, prawns, clams)

loans.name: Darlin Karin

texts.es:
Darlin tiene 31 años de edad, casado desde hace 12 años, vive en el Barrio Cabañas de San Pedro Sula, tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, quien esta estudiando. Su esposa hace productos de manualidades para vender y aporta al hogar.

Hace 8 años que Darlin se a dedicado a vender varios productos entre ellos artículos de cocina (ollas), productos de limpieza, lociones, champú, ropa (pantalones, blusas), etc. 
Este negocio lo estableció con dinero propio, luego solicito prestamos con ODEF para ir incrementando su inventario, este es el séptimo préstamo y lo va invertir en compra de ropa como ser: pantalones, blusas y lociones, ya que viene la temporada buena para la venta.
Su meta es seguir con este negocio, invirtiendo más para vender más y mejorar la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Darlin, 31, has been married for 12 years.  He lives in San Pedro Sula’s Cabañas neighborhood.  He has a 12 year old son who is in school.  His wife makes manual arts to sell and contribute to the home.

Eight years ago Darlin started selling varied products.  Among them are kitchen ware (pots), cleaning supplies, lotions, shampoo, clothes (pants, blouses), etc.  He started the business with his own funds and then requested ODEF loans to increase inventory.  This is his 7th loan and he will use it to buy clothes like pants and blouses and lotions because a season that’s good for sales is approaching.  His goal is to stay in business investing more to sell more and improve his home’s economy.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock merchandise.

loans.name: Roxinia

texts.es: Roxinia, tiene la edad  de  27 años, está en unión libre y vive actualmente con su esposo y su hijo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la buena asistencia de su plantación. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo ya sembrado, el cultivo esta condiciones regulares para la cosecha por lo cual pretende asistirlo de la mayor forma para dejarlo en optimas condiciones para la cosecha. Ella tienen como meta generar en su plantación la mayor de las mejorar para obtener de ella el máximo de las ganancias para su bienestar económico y mejorar su nivel de vida.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roxinia is 27 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She currently lives with her husband and her child, and they are her main priority.  With this loan, Roxinia will buy the fertilizers and supplies that she needs for her crops.  Roxinia has land suitable for growing the crops she has already planted, and the land is in adequate condition, but she plans to improve it and bring it up to top-quality condition for the harvest-time.  Her goal is to improve her crops so that she can get the greatest possible yield, and thereby increase her earnings.  This will provide for her economic well-being, and improve her standard of living.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had not taken prior loans with the state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.es: El señor Jean Paul vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Ica, el es un hombre soltero de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir que tiene en un puesto que es muy concurrido en la ciudad, el eligio este tipo de negocio porque le gusta negociar y vender, gana aproximadamente S/. 350 soles semanales, el es un hombre trabajador y luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Jean empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en ventas, diariamente trabaja con la ayuda de su familia, con el préstamo de los S/. 3000 nuevos soles que recibirá agracias a Kiva, el señor lo podrá invertir para la compra de mercadería navideña, también su crédito le permite  a Jean en pensar en el futuro y sueña con tener su propio puestos a nivel nacional y así poder vender ropa de buena calidad, su asesor de crédito piensa que es un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Jean Paul lives and works in the city of Ica.  He is 40 years old and single, and works selling clothing in a very busy stall in the city.  He chose this type of business because he likes to negotiate and sell.  He earns approximately 350 PEN a week.  He is a hardworking man and a fighter who very much wants to get ahead.  Jean started his sales business in 2008.  He works daily with the help of this family.

With the loan of 3000 PEN that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Jean Paul will be able to invest in buying Christmas merchandise.  His loan also allows him to think about the future and dream about having his own place at the national level and so be able to sell good-quality clothing.  His loan consultant thinks he is a good client.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the holiday season.

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela, de 30 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de su 2 hijos: Stif y Paola en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Palian. A pesar de estar solo, ella trabaja con ahínco para el futuro de sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la  crianza de vacas a las que engorda y reproduce para después venderlos a un buen precio. Ya tiene 10 vacas y desea aumentar su ganado. Todo lo que posee, es gracias a sus padres; quienes cuidan de su ganado en su pueblo natal de Huari, donde ella viaja cada vez que pueda. Pues también tiene que cuidar de su tienda de comestibles que hace poco abrió en un espacio al quilado en la ciudad, donde vive. El motivo de mudarse son los estudios de sus hijos, pues quiere maestros de nivel y una vida más cómoda para ellos, que son su única compañía. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Huari” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Gissela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Gissela is 30, and a courageous single woman. She lives with her two children, Stif, and Paola, in a rented house, located in Palian district. Despite being on her own, she works hard for her children's future, as she loves them very much.  Her main livelihood is raising cows, which she fattens and breeds, to then sell at a good price. She now has ten cows, and wants to add to her herd. 

Everything she has is thanks to her parents, who look after her cattle in her native village of Huari, where she travels whenever she can.  She also has to look after her grocery store, that she opened a little while ago in a rented space in the city where she lives. The reason she moved was her children's schooling, as she wants teachers for their level, and a more comfortable life for them, as they are her only companionship.  

She belongs to the "Huari" solidarity group, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is hoping for your contribution, so that she can make her plans a reality. Moreover, she promises to fulfil her instalment payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her group, because all the members are responsible people, and very supportive.  

When she receives her loan, Gissela will use the money to buy a cow, to add to her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón, tiene la edad  de  39 años, está casado y vive actualmente con sus hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar materiales como alambre para la mejora de su finca de ganado e insumos para sus pastos. El cuenta con una finca sembrada  de pasto para el cuido del ganado, actualmente necesita hacerle unas mejoras en cercas y pastos por lo cual opto por el crédito. El necesita darle a sus animales una buena calidad de pastos y a su vez buenas cercas para evitar la salida del ganado a otras fincas. El tienen como meta con estas asistencias darle mejor cuido al ganado para así poder tenerlo en buenas condiciones para la venta y así obtener el mayor de las ganancias para mejorar su nivel económico y su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramón, 39, is married, and currently lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority. With the loan he will buy materials such as wire for improving his cattle farm, and agricultural supplies for his pastures.  He has a farm planted with grass for raising cattle.  

At the present time he needs to make some improvements to his fences and pastures, so he decided to take out the loan. He needs to provide his animals with good quality grazing, and at the same time he needs good fences to prevent his cattle from straying onto other farms.

His goal is to use this assistance to take better care of his cattle in order to have  them in better condition for sale, and so get greater profits to improve his financial situation and his family's well-being.

This is his first loan with Fudecosur. He has not had other loans from regular banks before, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan on better terms, and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To maintain his cattle farm.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es: Erika Maria tiene 32 años. Tiene 3 hijos que están bajo  su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta mercadería en general. Ella tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar muy fuerte. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que empezó vendiendo pantalones y ropa interior  por lo que ofrecía sus productos de manera ambulante, fue aquí en donde inicio con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, cosméticos, perfumes, polvos, lápiz labial. Su deseo es establecer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Erika María is 32, and has three children to look after.  She sells general merchandise, and has been doing this for five years. She is a very responsible woman, who is devoted to her family; so she has always liked to work very hard.  

She started being self-employed by selling pants and underwear, and sold her products in the street. This was where she started this business. The loan she is applying for is for working capital to buy T-shirts, pants, cosmetics, perfumes, and lip pencils.  

Her wish is to set up her own store.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, pants, cosmetics, perfumes, powders, and lip pencils.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa, de 22 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Elvis, su esposo desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Devora a la que cuidan en una casa alquilada; ubicada en la ciudad de Huancayo. Ella nació en Usibamba, una localidad ganadera, donde sus pobladores viven de ello e incluso exportan productos lácteos a otros países. Es justo ahí que conoce a su esposo, quien trabaja como peón en la fábrica de exportación. Le va muy bien en su trabajo tanto así, que ahora ellos viven en la ciudad, donde Vanessa, aprovechó para dedicarse a la costura de diversas prendas de vestir, como polos, buzos, sacos y vestidos a base de telas. Cuenta que gana un promedio de 300 soles semanales, donde ella tiene que distribuirlos de acuerdo a las necesidades del hogar y capital de trabajo. Ya que están ahorrando, pues se encuentran construyendo su propia casa, donde puedan consolidar su familia y minimizar los gastos de arrendamiento. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los ganaderos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Vanessa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas para abastecer su negocio de confección.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 22, and a hard-working woman. She lives with Elvis, her husband for the last four years. They have a daughter, Devora, who they look after in a rented house, located in the city of Huancayo. She was born in Usibamba, a place where people make their living raising livestock, and even export dairy products to other countries. 

It's there that she met her husband, who works as a laborer in an export factory. He's doing very well in his job; so much so, that they live in the city now. Vanessa has taken advantage of this to work as a seamstress, sewing various articles of clothing, such as polo shirts, sportswear, and dresses. 

She says that she makes an average of 300 soles weekly, and has to allocate them according to the needs of her household, and her need for working capital. 

Since they are saving, they are  building their own house, where they can strengthen their family and minimize rent expenses. 

She belongs to the "Los Ganaderos" solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP. She is hoping you will contribute, so she can make her plans a reality. Moreover, she promises to fulfil her instalment payments. 

In addition, she is thankful to be part of her group, because its members are responsible people and very supportive.  When she receives her loan, she will use the money she has applied for to buy fabric to supply her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, de 45 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos: Jarol y Julissa a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. Su sonrisa es muestra de su vitalidad. Ella se dedica a la siembra de productos como papa, olluco y habas una vez al año, pero como desea tener productos de calidad, constantemente los cuida, abona y protege. Agradece a la agricultura, pues le permitió mantener a sus hijos, brindándoles los alimentos del día. Pero como no la ganancia no es estable, decidió incursionar en la costura, donde confecciona prendas de vestir de todo tamaño y calidad, cuenta que gana a las semana un promedio de 150 nuevos soles, pero en navidad, año nuevo y festividad agrícola de Santiago; en donde ella obtiene mejores ganancias.
