Pedro utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energial solar,  su comunidad queda ubicada montaña adentro y se dificulta contar con energía eléctrica,  servicio muy importante para el desarrollo y educación de su familia, una vez que termine con este credito piensa seguir trabajando con nuestra institución para que se le apoye con mas creditos para su negocio y mantenimiento de su finca.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  One of his older daughters attends school in Danlí because there aren't any secondary education centers in their village.  Pedro has been growing coffee for years.  He learned when he was a child, working alongside his father who taught him to work and maintain the farm.

Pedro currently has 3½ manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of coffee, growing on land which he owns.  After he finishes work with his coffee plants, he works in his grocery store.  The two businesses are sources of income which enable him to meet his obligations.

Pedro will use this loan to buy a solar panel.  His community is located right up in the mountains and it is difficult to receive electricity: a service which is very important for the development and education of his family.  Once he has repaid this loan, he plans to continue working with our institution so that he can receive the support of further loans for his business and to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Marta mujer trabajadora, vive con su mami, es comerciante su negocio consiste en la elaboración de pan de horno (rosquillas, cosas de hornos, empanadas de hornos, entre otros productos). Con el préstamo anterior incremento sus ventas. Mejorar su nivel de vida son sus planes. 
Esta solicitando este otro préstamo para la compra de materia prima, productos necesarios como: marca de leña, maíz, azúcar sulfitada, galones de leche, canela, queso, manteca, crema, tajos de dulce. Con esta inversión lograra mayores ventas. Agradece el apoyo de la financiera para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta is a hard-working woman who lives with her mom.  Her business is making bread, doughnuts, baked goods, baked empanadas and other products.  With her previous loan, she increased her sales.  Her plan is to improve her standard of living.

Marta is requesting another loan to buy raw materials and products she needs such as firewood, corn, white sugar, gallons of milk, cinnamon, cheese, butter, cream, dulce de leche, etc.  With this investment, she will achieve more sales.  She is grateful to the financial institution for their support in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 43 años es una luchadora madre; pues saca adelante a sus 3 hijos a los que cuida y sustenta económicamente, sola, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San pedro de saño. Con esfuerzo sacó adelante a sus hijos. Los cuales le apoyan con cariño. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, los que realiza en terrenos agrícolas arrendados, pues no tiene unos propios. Sus cultivos de papa, habas y trigo le brindan buenas ganancias en cada cosecha. Pues comercializa en la capital del país, ya tiene 19 años de experiencia en todo este tiempo, también se dedicó a venta de menestras en el mercado de Huancan, donde el precio de compra es mayor. También tiene 2 toros con los cuales realiza arado de tierra, pues cuando alquila otros, le cobran 100 nuevos soles por día y eso no le conviene. Ahora trabajará con más ahínco para brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos. Este es el décinotercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Delfina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en:
43-year-old Delfina is a tenacious mother who provides for her three children.  She cares for her children and supports them financially on her own.  They live in their own home which is located in the town of San Pedro de Saño.  Through her efforts, Delfina gets her children ahead in life.  They, in turn, support her with affection.

Delfina's main business is farming.  She grows her crops on rented farmland as she does not own her own.  Her potato, bean and wheat crops make her good profits with every harvest as she sells them in the capital city.  She has 19 years experience.  Delfina also sells mixed vegetables in Huancan market where the purchase price is higher and she has two bulls which she uses to plow the soil.  When she hires others, they charge her 100 soles a day which is not good.  Now Delfina will work with more determination in order to provide her children with a better education.

This is Delfina's thirteenth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has done with her previous loans.  Delfina enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  With your support, Delfina will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers to spread over her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad Group

texts.en:
Paula is a married mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. This area is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. Paula says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Paula is receiving her 9th loan with Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully paid all her previous loans, and after 5 years of investments, she is ready for higher loans and bigger investments. She will invest in this loan by purchasing different clothes like pants, skirts, blouses, and shirts, and she also wants to sell shoes. With her business profits she will reinvest in her business, because Christmas season is coming and all the businesses make better sales.

In the future, with her savings and profits, she is planning to have a better clothing store and a better house.
 
Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es: Doña Vidalia una mujer casada madre de  4 hijos, y comerciante desde mas de 22 años, quien a su edad no para su lucha continua en la vida, ve la necesidad de seguir haciéndolo ya que a través de su negocio vio crecer a sus hijos quienes ahora son jóvenes de éxito, ella desea seguir innovando su  negocio el cual es la venta de ropa variada de bebe, niños damas etc.,  porque su clientela así lo requiere,y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para al compra de ropa de bebe,damas y caballeros.  para su negocio Sabe cual es la importancia de quedar bien con sus clientes y busca el apoyo en un crédito para mejorar su negocio. Con ello sabe que sus ingresos mejoraran y conservara  una buena atención para las personas que la visiten.
texts.en: Vidalia is a married woman and the mother of four children.  She has been a shopkeeper for more than 22 years.  Even at her age, Vidalia does not stop working hard in life.  She sees the need to continue doing so as it is through her business that she raised her children who are now successful young people.  Vidalia would like to continue innovating in her business, selling a variety of clothing for babies, children, ladies, etc, because this is what her customers want.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy babies', ladies' and men's clothing for her business.  She knows the importance of pleasing her customers and she is looking for the support of a loan so that she can improve her business.  She knows that this will improve her income and she will be able to provide people who visit her business with a good service.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Maria Nella

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de 5 hijos, ella finalizo su secundaria y estudio un curso de secretariado ejecutivo, trabajo en un taller de costura administrando ese negocio pero una de sus hermanas le sugirió que pusiera ella su propio incluso fue una de ellas que le regalo utensilios de cocina para que empezara su negocio. Hoy en día su venta de fritos (comidas) leva ocho años este ha sido su primer negocio y fue gracias a este negocio que termino de preparar a sus hijos con una carrera universitaria, aunque todavía tiene 2 de sus hijos estudiando, ha podido sobrevivir y sostener su hogar. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar plátanos, cebolla, chiltoma, carne, que son parte de la materia prima que ocupa para realizar sus deliciosos platillos, también quiere  comprar sillas plásticas para que sus clientes se sienten a disfrutar sus comidas. Una de sus expectativas es tener un pequeño restaurante donde ofrezca de todo tipo de comida típica.
texts.en: María is 54 years old and lives in the city of Granada. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She finished high school and went on to take an executive secretarial course. She worked in a sewing workshop managing the business but one of her sisters suggested that she set up her own business and even gave her the kitchenware necessary to start her business as did others. To date she has been selling fried food for 8 years. This is her first business and it was thanks to this business that she managed to give her children a university education. Although she still has 2 children studying, she managed to survive and and take care of the household. She needs the loan to buy bananas, onions, pepper, meat which make up some of the raw materials she uses to make her delicious dishes. She also wants to buy plastic chairs so that her customers can sit down to enjoy their meals. One of her expectations is to have a small restaurant serving all kinds of traditional food.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, pepper and meat which are some of her raw materials.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Román, de 67 años es un hombre solitario. Vive en casa de su sobrino, ubicada en el asentamiento humano Juan Parra del Riego. Sus días se centran en hacer progresar su negocio. Su principal soporte económico es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó en la casa donde vive. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta es surtir su tienda con productos nuevos. Cuenta que incorporó hace poco variedades de frutas, verduras, carnes y condimentos con lo que obtuvo más clientes. Por ahora espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar la calidad de atención para tener clientes fieles que compren sus alimentos en su tienda, pues hay muchos como él en su zona.  Este es el décimosegundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Román de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de panetones de diversas marcas y tamaños, así también chocolates y leche para está temporada de navidad.
texts.en:
Román is 67 years old and a solitary man. He lives in his nephew's house which is located in the settlement of Juan Parra del Riego. His days are focused on making progress with his business. His economic mainstay is selling staple products from a fitted-out area in the house where he lives. He has 5 years of experience and what he likes the most is stocking his store with new products. He tells us that a short time ago he introduced different types of fruit, vegetables, meats and seasonings with which he attracted more clients. For now he hopes to grow the business more and improve the quality of service in order to have loyal customers that buy their food from his store as there are plenty of other stores like his in the area. This is his 12th loan with MFP and he hopes to have your support so as to realize his plans. On the other hand he promises to make his repayments, as he did with the previous loans. In addition he likes being a part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive. 

Román, with your support, will invest the money requested to buy panetones of different brands and sizes, as well as chocolates and milk for the coming Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy panetones, chocolates and milk for the Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es:
María integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, ella vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, helados en un local que adaptó en su propia casa. Además de esto prepara y vende ensaladas de todo tipo.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, a sus proveedores, distribuidoras y en la feria compra verduras para la preparación de sus ensaladas. 
En su negocio de abarrotes, atiende todos los días de la semana, mientras que la preparación de ensaladas solo las realiza de lunes a viernes.
María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Entre estos también comprará carbón, especialmente para las festividades de fin de año. 
Comenta que su negocio ha sido rentable y que le ha permitido vivir una vida confortable. 
María vive solo junto a su marido, ya que comenta que sus hijas ya están casadas y viven en cada uno de sus hogares, algunos días se dedica al cuidado de sus nietos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy unido y responsable, además de respetuoso con cada uno de sus integrantes. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones comenta que le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio, entre estos registrar sus gastos e ingresos del negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank “Fuerza de Mujer” which belongs to the city of Temuco. She sells groceries, candies, beverages, ice-cream in premises she set up in her own house. In addition she prepares and sells all kinds of salads. She buys her merchandise at the wholesale supermarkets, from her suppliers and distributors and the vegetables for her salads at the street market. She takes care of her grocery store every day whilst she only makes salads Mondays through Fridays. Maria has followed this routine for the last 10 years.

With the loan she will buy merchandise with which to stock her store. She will also buy coal especially for the year-end festivities. She tells us that her business has been profitable and has allowed to live a comfortable life. Maria lives alone with her husband as she says that her daughters are already married, each with her own home. Some days she takes care of her grandchildren. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded her by Fondo and the hope to invest in her business. She says that the communal bank group she belongs to is very responsable and united, respectful of  each one of its members. With regards the training, she says that they have helped her learn new strategies for organizing her business accounts, such as documenting the business' expenses and income. 

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kms to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In the surrounding areas there is a series of lakes (Pucon, Villarrica) and striking fauna and flora, concentrated in the nearby natural parks. It is of note that this region is inhabited by 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people that exist in our country.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her business and also coal specifically for the end-of-year festivities.

loans.name: Buena Semilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENA SEMILLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de alfombras, venta de artefactos, venta de verduras.

La señora Rosmery,  indica que hace dos años trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su tía. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de punto que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la 16 de julio  y posteriormente lo venderá en a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "BUENA SEMILLA" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Los Andes regional office. The group has eight members and is directed by a board headed by Rosmery. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, between them they have: food sales, carpet sales, appliance sales and vegetable sales. 

Rosemery has been working with Pro Mujer for two years and she joined the institution on her aunt's invitation. At the moment she has a knitting business, which she has been working in for years, learning the trade from her friend.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (in buying wool) which she will buy in 16 de julio [a commercial neighborhood in La Paz]  and then sell it on special order. This type of work helps her to earn resources to support her family, as she is a single mother with one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lucia Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia   se dedica a la venta de ropa  desde hace varios años, en la populosa calles de la ciudad de Quillacollo - Cochabamba, es clienta antigua nuestra siempre demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos,  su  esposo no participa porque trabaja en el departamento de Oruro, como minero en minas chicas, trabajando a destajo, el  crédito le servirá para surtirse de mas mercadería  de ropa por estas épocas de fin de año,  su garante que es su madre también esta dedicada a la venta de ropa pero ella lo hace en la zona de la cancha, cuenta con vivienda propia, en la zona Norte, también la Sra. Lucia siempre paga con puntualidad.
texts.en: Sra. Lucia has been selling clothes for several years in the crowded streets of the city of Quillacollo - Cochabamba. She is a long-standing member and has always shown herself to be responsible with regards repayments. Her husband does not participate because he works in the department of Oruro as a miner in small mines by the job with no fixed contract. The loan will be used to stock up with more clothing merchandise for the year-end season. Her guarantor, her mother, also sells clothing but she does so near the sports fields. She owns her own house in the northern area of the city. Sra. Lucia is always punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweaters and pants).

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
el sr. Wilfredo esta casado y es padre de 5 hijos, sus hijos menores estudian en la escuela de su aldea.
wilfredo se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 8 años, también se dedica a la siembra de maíz en donde actualmente trabaja con una manzana de tierra, estas son su fuentes de ingresos para satisfacer los gastos familiares y cumplir con sus compromisos adquiridos. 

Wilfredo utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, su casa de habitacion se encuentra montaña adentro y el servicio de energia electrica es casi imposible instalarlo por parte de la compañia gubernamental que es la encargada de darle energia a todo el pais.
gracias a este servicio obtendra una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos, asi mismo ayudarles a que estudien por las noches, 
una vez ya cancelado este panel  solar piensa seguir trabajando con nuestra institución para que se le apoye con créditos para el mantenimiento de su finca
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is married and the father of 5 children; the minors study at the village school. Wilfredo has been growing coffee for the last 8 years. He also plants corn and currently works on a block of land. These are his sources of income to cover family expenses and meet with his commitments.
 
Wilfredo will use the loan to buy a solar panel. The house he lives in is inside the mountain and it is virtually impossible for the government company responsible for distributing energy to the whole country to provide electricity services there.

Thanks to this service he will provide a better quality of life for his children as well as helping them to study at night. Once he has paid off the solar panel he plans to continue working with our institution so as to be supported with other loans for the maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer de 44 años y convive con Carlos, su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años; y habitan una casa propia en el Distrito de La Unión. Silvia y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura. En terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad siembra arvejas, habas, espinacas, zanahorias, etc. Productos cuya cosecha es muy rentable en temporadas, por ejemplo, estos meses la arveja tiene buena demanda, subiendo su precio. Así también se encarga de la crianza y venta de animales menores, como son los cuyes. “Mis clientes ya me conocen, vienen a mi casa cada cierto tiempo para comprar cuyes”, comenta Silvia, además cuenta que cada cuy lo vede a 15 soles ganado un promedio de 5 soles por animal. “Ambos negocios tienen sus ventajas, en la chacra tengo que esperar mínimo 4 meses para obtener ganancias, mientras que con los animales los ingresos son semanales, hasta diarios”, explica. Con el pasar del tiempo, Silvia espera ver a sus hijos cursar estudios superiores y desarrollándose en buenos trabajos, por tal motivo, ella y su esposo seguirán laborando para realizar sus metas. Éste sería el segundo préstamo que Silvia recibiría gracias a su ayuda, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Ángeles de la Unión 2”, se siente a gusto en su grupo comunal. Silvia con el crédito podrá comprar 2 sacos de abonos con 300 soles aproximadamente y con lo restante comprará cuyes para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 44-year-old woman who lives with Carlos, her partner.  The couple have two children, aged 15 and 11, and they live in their own home in La Unión district.  Silvia and her husband are farmers.  On farmland which they own, they grow peas, beans, spinach, carrots, etc.  These are products whose harvest is very profitable according to the season.  For example, right now peas are in good demand and so their price rises.  Silvia also raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs.  "My customers know me.  They come to my house every so often to buy guinea pigs" comments Silvia.  In addition, she tells us that she sells each guinea pig for 15 soles and earns on average 5 soles per animal.  "Both businesses have their advantages.  On the farm, I have to wait a minimum of 4 months to make profits whilst, with my animals, the income is weekly or even daily", she explains.  Over time, Silvia hopes to see her children pursue their higher education and make progress in good jobs.  For this reason, she and her husband will continue to work to achieve their goals.

This will be the second loan that Silvia has received with your help.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  She belongs to the "Los Ángeles de la Unión 2" community bank and feels happy with her community bank.  With her loan, Silvia will be able to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer for approximately 300 soles and use the rest to buy guinea pigs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, and guinea pigs

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: Lizeth de 19 años de edad, es una madre soltera de un pequeño niño de 1 año de nacido. Ella vive en la casa de sus padres en el barrio de San Juan  en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Lizeth sabe que para mantener a su hijo y crecer como familia, necesita trabajar duro y parejo, por ello no se aqueja cuando tiene que coger las herramientas y labrar la tierra. A pesar de su corta edad y situación sentimental, en las parcelas de terrenos que sus padres le otorgaron, siembra arvejas y papas. “Mis padres me enseñaron a trabajar y no es tan difícil, solamente ser constante y ponerle fuerza”, comenta. Además señala que la falta de capital hizo que algunas veces desista en la siembra de más parcelas por falta de abonos. Es por eso que se muestra confiada ante esta oportunidad. El negocio de las arvejas, por estos meses es más rentable que la papa, por esa razón traslada la cosecha al mercado mayorista de Tarma para expenderlos. Al lugar, compradores de distintas partes del país hacen su arribo atraídos por la variedad y calidad de productos que hallan. Lizeth confía, que años más adelante pueda contar con una casa propia, mejorar sus sembríos y expandirlos, aumentar sus sembríos; y de esa manera emprender hacia otros negocios. “Lo haré por mi hijo, que es mi prioridad, le daré lo que yo no tuve”, finaliza. Gracias a su ayuda Lizeth podrá acceder a su préstamo número 12 de MFP, motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto a su banco comunal, menciona sentirse alegre por que muchos de sus familiares y amigos lo integran. Con el dinero, Lizeth podrá adquirir semillas de papas y arvejas, cuya inversión asciende a 800 soles. Con lo restante comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en: Lizeth is 19 years old and a single mother of a one year old child. She lives in her parents' house in the neighbourhood of San Juan in the district of Huasahuasi. Lizeth knows that in order to take care of her child and grow as a family she needs to work long and hard and for this she doesn't complain. Despite her young age and the status of her relationship, she sows peas and potatoes on the plots of land her father gave her. "My parents taught me how to work and it's not so hard. Just be consistent and be strong," she says. She also states that a lack of capital meant that at times she had to desist from sowing more plots of land for lack of fertilizers. This is why she is confident about this opportunity. Peas are more profitable during these months than potatoes; for this reason she takes her crop to the wholesale market in Tarma to sell. There, buyers from around the country come to buy, attracted by the variety and quality of the products there. Lizeth is confident that in the years ahead she will have a home of her own, improve and increase her crops and increase her sowing and in this way expand into other businesses. "I will do it for my child who is my priority. I will give him what never had," she concludes. Thanks to your help, Lizeth will be able to obtain her 12th loan with MFP, for which she agrees to be punctual with her repayments. As for the communal bank, she mentioned feeling happy because many of her friends and relatives are members. With the money, Lizeth wil buy seed potatoes and peas which cost 800 soles (PEN). With the rest, she will buy bags of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and peas as well as organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Norma Guarachi

texts.es: La Sra. Norma tiene como actividad la elaboración D. pan, empanadas, alfajores, las cuales comercializa  ya sea en su mismo domicilio como entrega a  pedido en colegios indica que  tiene experiencia D. 3 años en esta actividad la actividad que nombramos lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio que se encuentra en el sudoeste D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba una zona periurbana en la Urbanización Mineros San Juan;  su esposo es contratista la señora indica  que con su actividad genera ingresos para su familia para su manutención; el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra D. harina, azúcar, manteca y otros insumos necesarios para continuar desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en:
Norma's business is making baked goods, bread, empanadas and alfajores, which she sells in her own home and delivers her orders to schools. She has three years of experience in this traD.. She runs her business in her own home found in the south east of Cochabamba city, in a peri-urban area in the Mineros San Juan neighborhood.

Her husband is a contractor and she says that her work creates an income for the maintenance of her family.

The money she is requesting will be used to buy flour, sugar, butter and other necessary ingredients to continue the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients.

loans.name: Duo El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
DUO EL TRIUNFO
El grupo está conformado por 2  personas quien es  La señora Santa Silvia que se dedica a la venta D. productos cosméticos y venta D. ropa intima D. mujer desD. hace  siete años inicio con la ayuda D. sus cuñadas que le enseñaron a vender el producto por catalogo  a domicilio y le otorgaron una pequeña cantidad D. productos para dar inicio a la venta y con el tiempo con la ayuda D.  sus papas pudo obtener  la venta D.  ropa interior D. mujer, tiene cuatro hijos menores D. edad,  el deseo que tiene es seguir creciendo en sus ventas   para salir adelante y poder ofrecer  lo necesario para sus hijos  y tener diversidad D. productos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. cosmeticos, la señorita Ana Cristina esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
'El Triunfo' group.

This group has two members: Santa Silvia and Ana Cristina.  Santa Silvia's business is selling cosmetics and ladies' underwear.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She started her business with the help of her sisters-in-law who taught her how to sell products through a catalog from home and gave her a small quantity of products so that she could start selling.  Over time, with the help of her parents, she was able to also start selling ladies' underwear.  Santa Silvia has four dependent children.  Her wish is to continue growing her sales so that she can get ahead in life and offer her children what they need.  She would also like to have a wiD. range of products.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics.  Ana Cristina is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 25 kilos of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nydia Sofia

texts.es: Nydia, de oficio sastre, vive en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, madre de familia,lleva alrededor de 10 años trabajando en esta actividad de manera indepeniente,este negocio lo aprendio gracias a un curso de costura que ella estudio despues de terminar su secundadria aprendio a elaborar de todo tipo de trajes pero se especializo en la confeccion de  vestidos para niñas porque segun sus clientas son los mejores diseños que ella hace, tambien  elaborar bolsos de tela , hace almohadas pero su especialidad son los vestidos para niñas.Ella realizo el credito para comprar tela , reglas , tijeras, hilos y repuestos para su maquina de coser. Esta inversion le ayudara adquirir tela a un buen precio y darle un buen mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser. Uno de sus proyectos es poner uns linea de vestidos para niñas y distribuirla fuera de Granada.
texts.en:
Nydia, a seamstress, lives in the city of Granada.  She is 40 years old, married, and has children.  She has been working independently at this business activity for around ten years.  She learned this business thanks to a sewing course that she took after she finished high school.  

She learned to make all types of clothing, but she specializes in making girls’ clothing.  According to her customers, those are the best designs that she makes. She also makes fabric bags and pillows.

She requested the loan to buy fabric, rulers, scissors, thread, and replacement parts for her sewing machine.  This investment will help her get fabric at a good price, and to perform good maintenance on her sewing machines.

One of her projects is to establish a line of clothing for girls and to distribute it outside of Granada.

loans.use: to buy fabric, rulers, scissors, thread, and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
el sr. Andrés tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos, Andres se dedica a la caficultura,  posee 1 manzana de tierra cultivada de café, el cuenta con mas de 10 años de experiencia en este rubro y a la vez trabaja en las fincas de sus amigos que le pagan su jornal, estos ingresos son suficiente para satisfacer los gastos que se efectúan en el hogar y para cubrir compromisos adquiridos.

Don Andrés, realiza sus trabajos de campo junto con sus familiares por lo tanto los ingresos que recibe cuando se llega la cosecha son casi 100% netos por que no hace pago de empleados. 

Andres utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, su casa esta ubicada en la montaña y ahi no existe el servicio de energia electrica, gracias a este panel de energia solar podra iluminarse por las noches y dejar de usar candiles, asi mismo desea llevar entretenimiento a su hogar por medio de TV.
una vez cancelado este sistema solar piensa seguir trabajando con nuestra institución para que se le apoye con créditos para mantenimiento de su finca.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 44, is married and has two children.  Andres is a coffee grower, and he has one “manzana” (1.728 acres ) of land where he grows coffee.

He says that he has over ten years of experience in this field.  He also works on his friends’ farms, and they pay him for his work.  These incomes are enough to pay for the household expenses and to cover the obligations that he has.

Andrés works in the field with his family.  Therefore, the income that he receives at harvest time is 100% profit because he does not have employees to pay.

Andrés will use the loan to buy a solar panel.  His house is in the mountains, and there is no electrical service there.  Thanks to this solar energy panel he will be able to have light at night and stop using candles.  In addition, he wishes to bring entertainment into his home by getting a TV.

Once he has paid off this solar system, he plans to continue working with our institution in order to support the maintenance of his farm with loans.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola vive en la zona del plan 3000 en la casa de su madre. Es madre soltera. La Sra. Fabiola se dedica a la venta de ropa (pantalones jeans para hombres y mujeres, conjunto para niñas y niños, poleras y blusas) las cuales vende a crédito. Es cliente antiguo de emprender era socia  en el banco de emprendimiento las progresivas en cinco ciclos. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería ropa de temporada para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que tiene muchos pedidos, la Sra. Fabiola además estudia en la universidad y ella misma se solventa con la venta de ropa para pagar sus estudios. Ella es una persona trabajadora que tiene como objetivo terminar sus estudios y de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Fabiola lives in Plan 3000 district, in her mother's house.  She is a single mother.  Fabiola's business is selling clothes (pants, men's and women's jeans, children's outfits, t-shirts and blouses).  She sells these products on credit.  Fabiola is a long-standing client of Emprender and was a member of the 'Las Progresivas' community bank for five loan cycles.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital, buying seasonal clothes for the end-of-year holiday season, as she has a lot of orders.  Fabiola also studies at university and she pays for her studies through her clothes sales.  She is a hard-working person whose goal is to finish her studies and thereby improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for the end-of-year holiday season

loans.name: Wilmer Jose

texts.es: El joven Wilmer  , es un pequeño agricultor de zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen un bebe de cinco meses , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , Wilmer desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar las tierras , en la actualidad tiene un plantillo de piña pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para brindarle el cuidado adecuando ; ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que un futuro sean buenos frutos tanto en la calidad, tamaño, sabor y sobre todo natural . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atravez de fondos kiva ya que los interés son bajos y apoyan al sector agrícola a pesar de ser de muy escasos recursos para que puedan salir hacia adelante .
texts.en: Wilmer is a young man who is a small-scale farmer in Ticuantepe region.  He lives with his wife who sells fruit and vegetables and the couple have a 5-month-old baby.  WIlmer's plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.  He has been working in farming for years as his parents taught him to work the land.  He currently has a crop of pineapples but he doesn't have the money he needs to provide them with suitable care.  He is lacking fertilizers and other supplies which he needs to ensure that, in the future, he has fruit which is of good quality, size and flavor and, above all, is natural.  He is grateful for the support that he receives from Afodenic through their Kiva fund as the interest rates are low and they support farmers, in spite of them having limited financial resources, so that they can make progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Kory Jaulitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY JAULITAS” iniciará su decimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Susana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de abarrotes, verduras, tejido a mano de guantes, tejido a máquina y tejido de mantas.

La señora Susana,  indica que hace seis meses trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alfombras que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lona) que comprara de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Kory Jaulitas” community bank are about to start their fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office.  This group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Susana.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include running a grocery store, selling vegetables, knitting gloves by hand, machine knitting and knitting blankets.

Susana tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for six months and joined through an invitation from a friend.  She has a business selling rugs which she has been working in for years.

The loan that Susana is currently taking out will be used to increase her capital, buying canvas in the 16 de Julio market.  She will later sell her products from her sales location..  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana replied that she likes the health services and the savings.

loans.use: to buy canvas

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline integrante del Banco comunal “Fuerza de Mujer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 20 años, ella vende frutas de temporada en un puesto que instalas en ferias libres. Su horario de trabajo es de domingo a viernes. Comenta que le va muy bien y conserva clientela antigua. 
Su mercadería la compra en la vega monumental.
Con el crédito comprará frutas de temporada  para abastecer su negocio, entre estos duraznos, cerezas, frutillas y paltas.
Sus metas en el negocio son prosperar y mantenerlo en el tiempo.
Jacqueline vive junto a su marido y sus cuatro hijos de 23, 19, 13 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son realizarse un tratamiento dental.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, solidario y empático con los demás integrantes. Además ha sido una nueva experiencia y le sirve como distracción de las labores domesticas. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para distribuir mejor sus ganancias.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the communal bank “Fuerza de Mujer” located in the city of Temuco. She has been in business for 20 years and sells seasonal fruit at a stall in the open markets. She works Sundays to Fridays and she says that she is doing very well and retains her old customers. She buys her merchandise at the Vega Monumental.

With the loan she will buy seasonal fruit to stock up her business such as peaches, cherries, strawberries and avocados. Her business goals are to prosper and take care of it in time. Jacqueline lives with her husband and their 4 children aged 23, 19, 13 and 6 years. Her dreams at the personal level are to have dental treatment. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo and the hope of investing in her business. She also comments that the communal bank she is a part of is very united, supportive and empathetic to other members. It has also been a new experience for her and serves as a distraction from her domestic work. Regarding the training this has helped her better distribute her profits.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Around it lie a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and striking native flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby parks. It should be noted that this region is inhabited by 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people that exist in our country.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to stock her business such as peaches, cherries, strawberries and avocados.

loans.name: Duo Colibri De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Historia duo colibri de san bartolo: doña oti se ha dedicado desde ya hace dos años a la venta de huevos,  ya que el tiempo esta muy difícil y para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa se decidió a comprar y vender huevos al principio comenzó con 2 cajas de huevo a la semana hoy nos comenta que se compra 6 cajas a la semana y viaja a diario al mercado  que es ahí donde los vende, y necesita el credito para compra de huevos por mayor ya que por mayor se lo dan mas barato.al igual que la siguiente socia tambien esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas sus negocio.
texts.en:
History of Duo Colibri De San Bartolo: Oti has sold eggs for two years now, as she is facing hard economic times and in order to help her husband with family expenses, she decided to buy and sell eggs. She started out with 2 egg cartons a week and now says she buys 6 cartons a week. She travels each day to the market, where she sells the eggs.

She needs the loan to buy eggs from wholesalers, as this is the cheapest way she can get them. the other partner is also requesting this loan to buy products to increase her business' supply.

loans.use: to buy eggs for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza Veronica

texts.es: La joven Esperanza, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, juntos a sus padres, esperanza tiene un pequeño taller de costura el cual adquirió con muchos esfuerzos, ya que es un negocio familiar y está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo Kiva , porque con los prestamos adquiridos logro incrementar sus ventas y comprar una maquina de costura lo cual le permitió darle empleo a un personas más para que le apoye cuando hay bastantes pedido tanto de uniformes , confección de damas y caballeros entre otros . Su sueño es lograr establecer no solo un taller si no también poder confeccionar vestido de Novias.
texts.en: Young Esperanza lives with her parents in Ticuantepe.  She has a small sewing workshop which she acquired through great effort.  This is a family business and she is happy about the support she has gotten from Kiva through Afodenic.  The loans have allowed her to buy a sewing machine, which allowed her to provide a job to someone who can help her when she has lots of orders such as uniforms and clothing for men and women among other things.  She dreams of having not just a workshop, but also of making bridal gowns.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

José desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, a sembrar maíz, fríjol a la crianza de pollos de engorde y a la ganadería a pequeña escala. De estas actividades recibe los ingresos para sostener a su familia, ya que sus padres desde pequeño le inculcaron el trabajo y como ganarse la vida.

Los pollos se los llegan a dejar a su casa una vez al mes, para siempre tener disponible para la venta. El concentrado y las vitaminas, entre otras cosas las va a comprar a la ciudad y se tarda una hora en llegar ahí, él va una o dos veces por semana a realizar estas compras.

José solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar concentrado, vitaminas y minerales para sus pollos de engorde. Debido a que recientemente José ha incrementado a 700 pollos en su granja, ya que en navidad aumenta la venta y el negocio es rentable.

De esta manera sacara los pollos a tiempo, para la temporada navideña y posicionarse en el mercado y tener buena demanda.

Don José es un hombre muy visionario, su meta es ahorrar de los ingresos que le genera la venta de sus pollos, para establecer un pequeño agroservicio, ya que el lugar donde vive, esta bastante retirado de la ciudad.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

José has been working in agriculture since he was very young, growing corn and beans, fattening chickens, and raising livestock on a small scale.  Through these business activities he makes the income he needs to support his family as his parents instilled in him the need to work and how to earn a living from a young age.

The chickens are dropped off at José's home once a month so that he always has some available to sell.  He buys the concentrate and vitamins, among other things, in the city (a trip which takes an hour).  He goes there once or twice a week to make these purchases.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy concentrate, vitamins and minerals for the chickens that he fattens because he recently increased the number of birds on his farm to 700 as sales increase around Christmas time and the business is profitable.

In this way, José will raise his birds in time for the Christmas season, position himself in the market, and experience good demand.

José is a very visionary man.  His goal is to save the income that he makes through his chicken sales so that he can set up a small agricultural supplies store because the place in which he lives is quite a long way from the city.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, vitamins and minerals for the chickens that he fattens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilma Antonieta

texts.es: La señora Wilma tiene su tienda de barrio, donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad,  es casada su esposo es albañil vive en la casa de sus suegros  en Villa Copacabana su tienda esta en plena esquina en un lugar estratégico, le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes,  el préstamo lo utilizara ya que le ofrecieron abarrotes en cantidad y quiere para comprar abarrote como  arroz,   azúcar , fideos, harina  tiene dos hijos menores una ya va al colegio el otro todavía por ser muy pequeño,  la Sra. Wilma es una persona trabajadora y se siente feliz por el apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en: Wilma has a neighborhood store where she sells basic household products.  She is married to a builder and lives in her in-laws' home in Villa Copacabana.  Her store is located on a corner, in a strategic location.  Her business is going very well as she has a lot of customers.  She will use her loan to buy some bulk groceries which she has been offered.  She would like to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles and flour.  Wilma has two dependent children.  Her daughter goes to school but her son doesn't go yet because he is still very young.  Wilma is a hard-working person who feels happy with the support that she has been given.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Lesther Antonio

texts.es: Lester, 29 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Granada, tiene 3 hijos de 3,8 y 13 años de edad, el 8 años esta en primaria y el de 13 años esta comenzando su secundaria. El es comerciante, el vive en unión libre con la madre de sus hijos. El inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su papa que tenia un tramo de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad de  Managua, Lester vendía junto con si padre y atendía el negocio pero después conoció a su pareja la madre de sus hijos y se mudo a la ciudad de Granada están ahí comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulante y con el tiempo y el apoyo de su esposa consiguieron un tramo(pequeño local) en el mercado de municipal de Granada donde vende pantalones, blusas, shorts, camisetas, calcetines. De esta manera es que Lester saca adelante a su familia y les lleva el alimento diario a su hogar. El realizo el crédito para compra mercadería de ropa nueva tales como jeans, camisas de vestir, blusas para damas, pantalones para niños, camisetas, el quiere aprovechar estos meses que se acerca la temporada navideña que es donde las ventas se ponen mejores y se mueve productos mas rápidos. Uno de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de infraestructura de su local para, asegurarlo para poder almacenar toda su mercadería en un mismo lugar y no tener que pagar alquiler de bodega para guardar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Lester, 29, lives in the city of Granada. He has three sons who are 3, 8 and 13 years old. The 8 year old is in primary school and the 13 year old is starting secondary school. He is a merchant and lives with his common-law wife, the mother of his sons.

Lester started his business with the help of his father who had a small section for clothing in the Managua city market. He used to sell and take care of the business with his father, but then he met his partner, the mother of his sons, and moved to Granada and began to sell clothing there as a traveling salesman. In time and with his wife’s support he obtained a locale (a small shop) in the Granada municipal market where he sells pants, blouses, shorts, shirts and socks. In this way, he is able to move his family forward and put food on the table every day.

Lester took out a loan to buy new merchandise such as jeans, dress shirts, women’s blouses, children’s pants and t-shirts. He wants to take advantage of these months during the fast-approaching Christmas season when his sales improve and his goods move most rapidly. One of his goals is to improve the shop’s infrastructure so he can store all his goods in the same place and not have to pay to rent a warehouse to hold his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as jeans, dress shirts, women’s blouses, children’s pants and t-shirts; he wants to take advantage of the fast approaching holiday season when sales improve and his goods move most rapidly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for weaving her products and traditional clothes to sell

loans.name: Diana Yisela

texts.es: La señora Diana , es comerciante de comida correinte y rapida , ella esta muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo Kiva , ya que por ser bajos su intereses y las cuotas comodas, cn las ganacias del negocio logro comprar un frezzer ; el cual lo esta aprovecha para vender carnes, embutidos , pollo ,etc , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar una comprar fuertes de productos ya que estos tienen bastante demanda , sus planes es seguir trabajando fuerte para que algun dia pueda comprar un terrenito y hacer su casa para vivir dignamente .
texts.en: Sra. Diana sells fast food. She is very happy with the help provided to her by Afodenic through Kiva, since the interest is low and her payments are reasonable. With her business profits she was able to buy a freezer which has enabled her to sell meat, sausages, chicken, etc. However, she lacks sufficient capital to buy strong products in high demand. Her plan is to continue working hard so that some day she will be able to buy a piece of land and build her house in order to live with dignity.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, groceries, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 47 años de edad, convive hace 18 años con su pareja. Ambos tienen 3 hijos de 24, 23 y 14 años. Esta familia vive en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Julia se dedica a las labores del campo. En sus parcelas propias de terrenos siembra: papas, arvejas, maíz y habas. Con la ayuda de su esposo ha sabido combatir las inclemencias que este arduo trabajo implica. Así comenta, que años atrás sus sembríos de papas se secaron por culpa del exceso de lluvias y por falta de cuidados. Ahora no solo cultiva papas, pues ha sabido distribuir su tiempo para variar su producción con verduras y hortalizas. “Me va bien, ya tengo compradores que vienen de Lima y se llevan las papas, y verduras”, comenta Julia, agregando que este sistema de trabajo es conveniente por que evita que sus cosechas se malogren o pudran. De igual manera, cría y engorda animales de granja como: vacas, cuyes y chanchos. A estos los vende cada quince días a 1 mes, en el caso de cuyes; y cada 4 a 5 meses, los chanchos y vacas. Julia espera construir su casa propia, por esa razón se esfuerza cada día para incrementar sus ahorros, por que sabe que, con dedicación y perseverancia podrá conseguirlo. Éste sería su préstamo número 13 de MFP. Se siente contenta de continuar trabajando con la entidad, por eso se muestra firme en su decisión de pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad. A la vez menciona que le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal. Con el dinero del crédito podrá adquirir semillas de arvejas y habas, con un promedio de 1200 soles, con lo restante comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Julia, 47, has been living with her partner for 18 years. Together, they have three sons, who are 24, 23 and 14 years old. This family lives in a rented house in Huasahuasi district. Julia works in the fields. She plants potatoes, sweet peas, corn and broad beans on her own parcels of land 

With her husband’s help Julia has learned how to combat the inclemencies that this arduous work involves. She states that years ago her potato fields dried out because of excess rain and lack of care. Now, she not only cultivates potatoes but has learned how to apportion her time in order to vary her production with green vegetables and legumes. “I am doing well, since I have buyers who come from Lima and take away my potatoes and vegetables,” Julia states, adding that this system is advantageous, because it prevents her crops from spoiling or rotting. In addition, she raises and fattens farm animals such as cows, guinea pigs and pigs; she sells the guinea pigs every 15 days to one month while she sells the pigs and cows every four to five months.

Julia hopes to build her own house and for this reason she works every day to increase her savings because she knows that with dedication and perseverance, she will eventually be able to do so. This will be her 13th loan from MFP. She is pleased to continue working with the organization and is committed to making her payments on time. At the same time, she notes that she likes working with her communal bank. With money from the loan she will be able to purchase pea and bean seeds for, on average, 1,200 soles, and with the rest she will buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea and bean seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nilder

texts.es:
Nilder de 23 años de edad, convive con Nelcy hace 3 años. Él y su pareja vieron nacer a Jacky, su hija de 1 año. Nilder y su familia viven en la casa de su mamá en el anexo de San Juan en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Desde niño su padre le enseñó a laborar las tierras. Actualmente, con terrenos de su propiedad puede producir una variedad de productos como: papa, arveja y olluco, cuyas cosechas son cada 3, 4 o 6 meses. “Mientras cosecho papas, cultivo los ollucos y abono las arvejas, así intercalo el trabajo para que el dinero no falte cada mes”, detalla. Así también cuenta con ganado vacuno, que le sirve como apoyo en el arado de sus tierras. La “yunta”, es una herramienta mitad animal y mitad metálica que aprovecha la fuerza de las reses y una punta metálica  para abrir las tierras. Con el alquiler de su “yunta”, Nilder obtiene ingresos extras, ya que al día cobra de 20 a 25 soles.  Tiempo atrás, este joven padre vio sus cultivos marchitarse y quemarse, esto se debió a las plagas y a la falta de suministros para su crecimiento. Ahora, Nilder sabe como combatir estos problemas.
Más adelante, espera comprarse un pequeño auto para realizar servicios de transporte y uso personal, además de alquilar un local y abrir una tienda de abarrotes, es una de sus primeras metas. Con éste sería su crédito número 13 de MFP, por esa razón hace la promesa de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. “San Juan”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, con el que trabaja hace mucho tiempo, menciona sentirse respaldado por sus compañeros.
El dinero del préstamo lo destinará en la siembra de 20 sacos de papa de la variedad “Única”, por tal razón comprará guano de corral, abonos orgánicos y algunos remedios para espantar a los insectos.
texts.en:
Nilder, 23, has been living with his partner, Nelcy, for 3 years. He and his partner witnessed the birth of Jacky, their one year old daughter. Nilder and his family live in his mother’s house in San Juan settlement in Husahusai district. From an early age, his father taught him how to work the land. 

Currently, Nilder can produce a variety of products on land that he owns, such as potatoes, green peas, ollucos (tubers), which he harvests every 3, 4 or 6 months. “While I harvest potatoes, I cultivate ollucos and fertilize the peas, thereby spreading out the work so that there is money coming in each month,” he states. In addition he has cattle that help him plow his land. The “yunta” [a wooden yoke fastened to the heads of two animals and attached to a plow] is a tool that is half animal and half metal that takes advantage of the cattle’s strength and a metal spike to plow the land. By renting out his “yunta”, Nilder obtains extra income, collecting 20 to 25 soles a day. Awhile back, this young father saw his crops wither and burn due to pest infestations and a lack of supplies to help them grow. Now, Nilder knows how to combat these problems.

Later he hopes to buy a small auto in order to provide transportation services and for personal use. One of his first goals is to rent a shop and open a grocery store. This will be his 13th loan from MFP. Consequently, he promises to make his payments promptly. His communal bank is named “San Juan” and he has worked with it for a long time. He mentions that he feels he has the endorsement of his fellow members.

Nilder will use the money to plant 20 sacks of seed potato of the “Unica” variety, to which he will apply barnyard guano, organic fertilizer and some remedies to frighten off insects.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers, compost and remedies against insects.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
GUDELIA 
  necesita otro crédito para la inversión en compra de nateria prima para la confeccion de tejidos y en la venta de ropa típica  Güipiles, Blusas y Cortes  que tiene en su domicilio y así mismo  tener diversidad de  labores y colores ya que en estos últimos meses crecen las ventas en ropa  y también  poder invertir en adornos navideños que tiene ubicada en el parque de su comunidad donde ofrece su producto quien tiene a una persona que le ayuda en atender ese negocio  y en la venta de ropa típica ella  se encuentra atendiendo   así mismo pueda generar mas ganancias  y poder  surtir en la misma su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando  con su venta ya que muchas personas la conocen y la buscan para la compra de su producto  su deseo personal es seguir adelante  para apoyar a sus hijos en  lo que necesiten  agradece a fape  por la confianza que tiene en ella .
texts.en:
Gudelia needs another loan to invest in buying raw materials to make hand-woven items and in the sale of traditional clothes such as güipiles, blouses and skirts she has in her house, and also have a greater variety of items and colors, as clothing sales increase during the last months. She also wants to purchase Christmas decorations to put up in her community park where offers her products.

Se has another person who helps her run the business and sell regional clothes, and she also attends to customers herself. She wants to increase revenues in her business and be able to supply the business. Her greatest wish is to keep selling her products because many people know her and come to her to buy her products.

She wants her business to get ahead so she can help her children get what they need. She thanks FAPE for placing trust in her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make hand-woven items and buy regional clothes.

loans.name: Roddy Alfredo

texts.es: Roddy vive con su esposa y  su menor hijo en Ica Perú, empezó su negocio en el año 2006 en el área de transporte. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y 6 días a la semana. Recibiendo ayuda de su  familia. Con el préstamo de 1500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA podrá realizar mantenimiento general a su automóvil. También su crédito permitirá  a Roddy obtener el sueño de la casa propia y tener mejor calidad de vida, Ya que Roddy es un hombre luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante conjuntamente con su familia.  Su asesor de crédito cree que es un  excelente cliente y pagará cumplidamente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Roddy lives with his wife and young son in Ica, Perú. He started his business in the transportation area in 2006. He works about eight hours every day for six days a week and receives help from his family. With the loan of 1,500 soles he will obtain, thanks to KIVA, he will be able to do general maintenance on his automobile. The loan will also eventually enable him to fulfill his dream of having his own house and a better quality of life, because Roddy is a hardworking man who greatly wants to get ahead, together with his family. His credit counselor believes that he is an excellent client and that he will make his payments on time.

loans.use: to do general maintenance on his automobile.

loans.name: Los Andes (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Andes está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios, se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 16, 13 y 10 años de edad los mismos que aun viven en sus casa a pesar de que la mayor ya está comprometida, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.
 
Ella para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de tres a cuatro horas por dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene cinco  años que se dedica a la venta de estos productos y lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y espera cumplir para seguir recibiendo los créditos y beneficios que ofrece la fundación.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran almacén en el centro de la ciudad.

En la foto del grupo faltan el Señor Danny y la Señora Mayra que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo. En la foto están dos niños que son hijos de 2 socias.
texts.en:
Los Andes Communal Bank is made up of 13 women and 2 men. They meet every two weeks in an area of the city of Portoviejo known as El Guabito, a place of hard-working, peaceful people dedicated to their families.  This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank that is going to be useful to them, since with the loans they can improve their small businesses.  They work in various activities such as business, service, food sales, and others.

Gloria lives in this place.  She is 37 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has three children, ages 16, 13, and 10.  All of them still live at home even though the oldest daughter is engaged; the younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a security guard.
 
She works selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to have her own resources and with them help her husband.  She works every day for three or four hours, leaving the products on credit and collecting the payments every weekend.  She has been selling these products for five years and what she sells most are the perfumes, since they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.  This is her first cycle in the communal bank.  She is the president of the group and she hopes to perform, to continue receiving loans and the benefits that the foundation offers.

Her dream is to have a big store downtown in the city.

Danny and Mayra are missing from the photo since they were at work when it was taken. There are two children of two of the women in the picture.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 29 años de edad, hace 5 años convive con su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años. Habitan un hogar propio en Barrio de Golpachaca en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Como la mayoría de comuneros que residen su comunidad, Eliza (como la llaman de cariño), se dedica a la agricultura.  Cuenta con terrenos agrícolas en las faldas de los cerros que rodean su barrio, en ellos siembra arvejas, habas, olluco y papas. Sus hijos aún son pequeños, por eso sólo trabajan la tierra, su esposo y ella. Ambos coordinan los traslados y ventas posteriores a la cosecha. Por esa razón pueden movilizarse y contactarse con más compradores. “De uno de mis terrenos cosecho 50 sacos de papas, los que vendo al instante en el mercado”, comenta alegre, pues es consciente de que, los productos de esta parte de la sierra son bien solicitados. Elizabeth espera, con el pasar del tiempo, tener una estabilidad económica que le permita brindarles a sus hijos la educación que ellos elijan. Por tal motivo, piensa adquirir un automóvil para que su esposo pueda realizar el servicio de transporte cuya ruta sería la de Tarma – Huasahuasi y viceversa. “Se gana bien”, concluye. Con su ayuda, Eliza accedería a su préstamo número 13 de MFP. “Siempre he sido puntual pagando las mensualidades y ahora también me comprometo a serlo”, advierte. Le gusta trabajar con “Las Águilas”, su banco comunal, por el respaldo y apoyo que recibe de sus integrantes. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de 20 bolsas de abono de 118 soles cada uno, como mínimo, para fertilizar sus sembríos de papas, habas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 29, has lived with her partner for five years.  Together they have two children, ages 10 and 4.  They live in their own home in Barrio de Golpachaca in the Huasahusai district.

Like the majority of the people who live in their community, Eliza (as she is called affectionately) works in agriculture.  She has croplands on the side of the hills that surround her neighborhood where she grows peas, beans, olluco [a root vegetable], and potatoes.  Her children are still small, so this is why she and her husband only work the land.  They both coordinate the removal and later sale of the harvest.  Because of this they can get around and get in touch with more buyers.  "From one of my plots of land I harvest 50 bags of potatoes, which I sell right away in the market," she comments happily, since she is aware that the products in this part of the highlands are in great demand.

Elizabeth hopes to have, in time, a financial stability that will allow her to give her children the education they want.  For this reason she plans to get a car so her husband can provide transportation service along the Tarma–Huasahuasi route and back.  "You earn good money," she concludes.

With your help, Eliza will obtain her thirteenth loan from MFP.  "I have always been punctual with my monthly payments and now I again am committed to that," she advises.  She likes to work with Las Águilas, her communal bank, because of the support and help she receives from the members.

She will invest the loan money in buying 20 bags of fertilizer at a minimum of 118 PEN each to fertilize her potato, bean, and pea fields.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Pamela Ivett

texts.es: La señora Pamela , junto a su familia , el esposo labora como electricista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , ella es comerciante de ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos , con sus ganancias a logrado pagar su prestamo y esta muy contenta por el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Kiva ya que con el credito anterior logro realizar las divisiones de la vivienda , ahora necesita invertir en bloques , cemento , zinc , etc , para mejorar su cocina ya que la que tiene esta muy deteriora por los años . Su sueños es que cuando termine con la construcción de la vivienda logre comrpar un pequeño tramo en el mercado para su pequeño negocio .
texts.en:
Pamela lives with her family.  Her husband works as an electrician to help her with the household expenses, since they have children in their care.  She sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.  With her profits she has managed to pay for her loan.  She is very happy about the support and the trust that Afodenic places in her through the Kiva fund, since with the previous loan she managed to make the room divisions in her house.

Now Pamela needs to invest in concrete blocks, cement, corrugated aluminum, etc., to improve her kitchen, which has deteriorated over the years.

Her dream is that when she finishes with the home construction she will be able to buy a little piece of land in the market for her small business.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, corrugated aluminum, and iron.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 41 años hace 20 años convive con su pareja. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3. La casa donde habitan es propia. Ana, desde niña creció en el Barrio de San Juan en el distrito de Huasahuasi. El lugar se caracteriza por sus suelos fértiles y climas adecuados para la producción de papas y variedades, así como arvejas. Gracias a ello, Ana ha podido consolidar sus sembríos de ambos productos, los que para ella son los más rentables.  “Todos los domingos de cosecha llevo mis arvejas al mayorista (mercado), ya tengo mis compradores, ellos me llaman y me esperan”, comenta triunfadora. A su vez en los meses de marzo, abril y mayo, la venta de papas también le sonríe; pero estos productos son destinados hacia la ciudad de Lima, por que el precio es más favorable. El trabajo en la tierra es cansado y mucho más para una mujer, por eso, ella y su pareja contratan personal para el apoyo en la siembra y cosecha. Ana ansía contar con más terrenos de cultivo, si no los compra, por lo menos los arriendará. “Desde niña me gusta el campo y así seguiré hasta el final”, menciona contenta. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 de MFP. Da su palabra de pagar sus cuotas tan como lo hizo anteriormente. Se siente a gusto y entusiasmada con la dupla de la entidad financiera y su banco comunal. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de sacos de abonos. Estima que gastará alrededor de 1800 soles, tanto para los terrenos de papa y arvejas. Lo restante lo destinará en el pago de personal y servicio de transporte.
texts.en: Ana is 41 years old and has lived with her partner for the last 20 years. They have 5 children but only 3 of them live with them. The house they live is their own. Ana grew up in the Barrio de San Juan, in the district of Huasahuasi. The area is noted for its fertile land and climate suitable for growing potatoes and other crops such as peas. Thanks to this, Ana has been able to consolidate her sowing of both, which for her are the most profitable. "Every Sunday during harvest time I take my peas to the wholesale market. I already have buyers. They call me and wait," she states triumphantly. During the months of March, April and May, she sells potatoes which also goes well for her. However, these products are destined for the city of Lima because the price is more favourable. Working the land is tiring and more so for a woman; that is why her partner and her hire labourers to help with the planting and harvesting. Ana is eager to have more farmland, if not bought then at least leased. "From childhood I have Iiked the countryside and always will," she says happily. This will be her 12th loan with MFP. She gives her word that she will make her repayments as before. She feels excited and comfortable with the duality of the financial entity and her communal bank. She will invest the money from the loan in buying sacks of compost. She estimates spending around 1800 soles (PEN) on the potato and pea fields. The rest she will allocate to the payment of staff and transportation services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and pay for labour.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: La Sra. Fanny vive la zona del abasto en una casa en anticrético, es madre soltera tiene 45 años, tiene dos hijas las cuales le ayudan venden con ella y también estudian. La Sra. Fanny se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva (pantalones jeans para hombres y mujeres, conjunto para niñas y niños, poleras y blusas ropas que las compra  en la feria son productos panameños) las cuales vende a crédito y también ambulan  por los mercados vendiendo sus  mercaderías. Es el segundo crédito que se le da en su anterior crédito  a demostrado ser cliente responsable, el crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería (ropas, chinelas y carteras) y el resto del dinero es para el nuevo negocio que esta implantando, en el mercado abasto la venta de papas por bolsada  y cebollas por bolsada, un negocio por el cual ella esta viendo buenas ganancias. La Sra. Fanny es clienta que esta siempre pendiente de cualquier tipo de negocio, mujer preparada y con ganas de superación.
texts.en: Sra. Fanny, 45, lives in an anticretico in Abasto.  [An "anticretico" is a kind of lease-purchase tenancy arrangement common in Bolivia.] She is a single mother with two daughters who help her with her business when they're not in school.  Fanny sells new clothing (jeans for men, women and children; sweaters; and blouses), all made in Panama, that she buys from a local wholesale market.  She works as a street vendor and sells on credit.  This is her second loan and she proved before that she is a responsible borrower.  She will use part of the loan to buy merchandise (clothing, footwear, purses) for her business and the rest for a new business selling bulk supplies of potatoes and onions in the market at Abasto. She is confident that she will earn a good income from the new business.  Sra. Fanny is determined to make a success of whatever she does because she's driven and hard working.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail businesses.

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es:
Heraclio de 64 años, es un hombre casado pero separado hace 2 años, su esposa vive en Lima con 2 de sus hijos, los otros 2 están casados. Él se halla en un hogar propio en el distrito de Huasahuasi. A pesar de su edad, Heraclio continúa labrando la tierra. Sus terrenos de cultivos son propios, en ellos siembra en su mayoría papas y arvejas. El negocio de las papas es rentable para él, en los meses de febrero a junio, viaja con toda su producción a la ciudad de Arequipa, ahí vende las papas como semillas a 1.20 soles, lo cual es más beneficioso que ofrecerlas como comestibles pues su precio a penas llega a 0.50 céntimos.
En esos meses, Heraclio vende alrededor de 3000 kilos de papas como semillas, solo en una visita, “Al mes viajo 2 veces, y allá ya tengo clientes precisos, me va bien”, comenta. Así también comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma pero ahí solo ofrece de 30 a 50 kilos.  Heraclio tuvo que esquivar dificultades, tales como la falta de dinero, pérdidas por el mal tiempo y hasta problemas familiares, pero él no se cansa y decide proseguir a pesar de todo. Es un hombre trabajador.
Sus metas se encuentran dentro de la agricultura. Espera ampliar sus ventas y producir más cantidades.
