Con su ayuda, Heraclio accedería a crédito número 12 de MFP, por eso confía en que no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad. Con respecto a su banco comunal, comenta sentirse contento con los amigos que hizo en tantos años. Con la mayor parte del dinero del préstamo, adquirirá fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos, los que compra cada 15 días invirtiendo de 700 a 800 soles.
texts.en:
Heraclio, 64, has been separated from his wife for 2 years.  His wife lives in Lima with 2 of their children and two others of his children are married and independent.  Heraclio lives in a house he owns in Huasahuasi.  He's a farmer and, despite his age, still working his farm.  He grows potatoes and peas.  His potato business is particularly attractive because he sells his crop for seed in Arequipa for 1.20 soles [a kilo?--not clear], much better than the 0.50 soles [a kilo?] that it would fetch if he sold it for food.  
Heraclio sells around 3000 kilos of potatoes on single visits between February and June: "I go 2 times a month to meet my customers there", he says.  He also sells his crop at the wholesale market in Tarma, but only 30 to 50 kilos at a time.  Heraclio faces problems such as a lack of money, crops lost to bad weather and even family troubles, but he never flags and perseveres no matter what.  He's a hard-working man. 
All of his goals revolve around his farming business.  He wants to increase the size of his crop and his sales.  With your help, Heraclio will get his 12th MFP loan.  He has a good record of repaying past loans on time and he is happy with his community bank.  He will use part of this loan to buy fertilizer and manure, a little every 15 days, for a total of 700 to 800 soles.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.es: La señora Rose Mary es una señora sola y tiene un hijo dependiente sus otros hijos ya son independientes de ella; se dedica a la limpieza y en particular al tejido de prendas de hilo especialmente para niñas menores de 8 años, ella vive en el Plan 3000, ella trabaja para poder mantener a su hija para poder subsistir especial mente ella nesecita el prestamo para compra de materiales e insumos y aumentar sus ventas y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija. Ella esta muy agradecida porque no es la primera vez que recibe este beneficio y ha podido responder de forma favorable y sin retrasos.
texts.en: Sra. Rose Mary is a single mother with one child living at home.  Her other children are grown and independent.  Rose Mary makes a living cleaning and weaving cloth for children's clothes.  Her main market is young girls, 8 years and younger.  She lives in Plan 3000.  She has to work to support her daughter.  She needs this loan so that she can buy the materials and supplies she needs to grow her business and, in turn, improve both her and her daughter's quality of life.  Rose Mary is very grateful for your help because this isn't the first time that she's received a loan.  She was able to repay past loans on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her clothing business.

loans.name: Melida Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Melida del Carmen tiene 35 años de edad,  esta casada y tiene 5 hijos, junto con su esposo se dedican a la caficultura, en la actualidad cuentan con 4 manzanas de café que son la fuente principal de ingresos,  a la vez su esposo se dedica a la agricultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para el consumo familiar. 

Melida utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, la zona en donde viven es muy lejana y carecen de este servicio basico, gracias a este panel solar podran iluminarse por las noches y tambien podran ver television, doña Melida piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca.
texts.en:
Melida del Carmen is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  She and her husband are coffee growers.  They currently have four manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of coffee which is their main source of income.  Her husband also works in agriculture which makes extra income for their family.

Melida will use this loan to buy a solar panel.  The area in which they live is very remote and they lack this basic service.  Thanks to this solar panel, they will be able to light their home at night and also watch television.  Melida plans to continue working with Prisma in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Franklin , anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio , pero ahora le trabaja a un empresa privada , su esposa se quedo con el negocio ya que sus sueños es poder terminar de construir la vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser profecionales , don Franklin se siente muy agradecido con Kiva , ya que si ellos no fuese posible salir hacia adelante por sus interes y sus cuotas que se ajustan a presupuesto de personas humilde y de escasos recursos , el credito lo quiere para comprar zinc y perlines ya que estos tiempo de lluvia el agua se pasa en toda la vivienda .
texts.en: Franklin used to work as a salesman but now he works for a private company.  His wife took over the business.  Franklin's dreams are to be able to finish building his home and to support his children so that they can continue in school and become professionals.  Franklin is very grateful to Kiva as, if it were not for them, he would not be able to get ahead in life.  Their interest rates and repayment terms adapt themselves to the budgets of humble, poor people.  Franklin would like this loan to buy sheets of metal and beams as, during this rainy season, the water seeps in all over his house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal and beams

loans.name: German Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Germán Francisco Comenzó su negocio  hace unos 11 años cuando con los ahorros de su salario como contratista de pintura e infraestructura en el Ingenio San Antonio compro una línea de taxi con su permiso de operación para ofrecer el servicio de transporte público y privado, en la ciudad, el ya tenía un automóvil. Lo empezó con esfuerzo propio, con las utilidades del trabajo y como medio de empleo a uno de sus hijos quien es el que se encarga de manejar la unidad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, combustible, repuestos entre otros.
texts.en: Germán Francisco started his business 11 years ago when he used his salary from his job as a painting and infrastructure contractor at the San Antonio sugar refinery to buy a taxi route with operating license so that he could offer a public and private transport service in the city.  He already owned a vehicle.  He started the business through his own efforts, with the profits from his work.  It also provides a job for one of his children who drives the vehicle.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires, fuel, spare parts, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: la señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida, es hermana de una cliente antigua de la agencia, su hermana es muy puntual y responsable, la señora Mónica siempre fue garante pero ahora se decidió a sacar un crédito, la señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida en un anaquel hace ya varios años, su puesto esta ubicado en la zona Tejada Sorsano, su puesto esta alquilado y la señora quiere agarrar el puesto en anticrético por este motivo solicito el crédito para el anticrético de su puesto de venta, su deseo es poder algún día comprarse ese puesto de venta,  la señora tiene una hija que tiene 17 años ella esta estudiando en colegio, la señora esta actualmente separada, sola saca adelante a su hija y se siente feliz por la oportunidad que se le brindo en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mónica sells food.  She’s the sister of a longstanding agency client; her sister is very punctual and responsible.

Mónica had always acted as loan guarantor but now wants to take out a loan.  She has sold food in a stand for several years now.  Her stand is located in the Tejada Sorsano zone and she rents it.  She now wants to acquire the stand through the ‘anticrético’ modality [a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] and this is why she’s requesting the loan.  Her wish is to someday be able to buy the stand.

She has a 17-year-old daughter going to high school and she is currently separated.  She raises her daughter by herself and feels happy for the opportunity she’s been given through the granted loan.

loans.use: to pay rental contract for her stand.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 41 años, es una mujer casada. Ella y Jesús, su esposo vieron nacer a 2 hijos, que actualmente tienen 21 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en armonía bajo un techo propio, en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Francisca y Jesús se dedican hace muchos atrás a la agricultura. En los terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad siembran papa, arvejas y olluco; productos que al cosecharlos derivan al mercado mayorista para su venta al por mayor. “Me conviene vender de esa manera, por que me evito que mis cosechan se pudran o malogren, así también gano dinero al instante”, explica. A la vez, en los pastizales y campo abierto que cuenta su comunidad alimentan a sus animales, como son: carneros y chanchos. A éstos cría y engorda. Después de 4 o 5 meses los vende, ganando por ganado alrededor de 100 soles. En los meses de diciembre y enero, los ofrece a mayor precio, por ser fechas de fiestas navideñas y año nuevo. Francisca, se ve más adelante como una productora mayorista que expenderá verduras, hortalizas y tubérculos al por mayor, no sólo en la ciudad de Tarma, sino que piensa viajar a otras ciudades. Sabe que el precio fuera de la ciudad le será más conveniente. Con su apoyo podrá acceder a su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por eso se muestra firme en su decisión de pagar las cuotas en los días establecidos. Además comenta que compartir intereses y metas, es lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal. “Estoy preparando una siembra de papas para mayo, para eso compraré bolsas de abono y fertilizantes”, manifiesta. Sacando sus cálculos, Francisca invertirá 1200 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 41, is a married woman. She and Jesús, her husband, had two children who are currently 21 and 7 years old.   This family lives in harmony in their own house in the Huasahuasi district.  Francisca and Jesús have been farmers for many years.  They grow potatoes, peas and ‘olluco’ [an Andean tuber] on farmland they own and when harvested they are sold at the local wholesale market.  “It’s advantageous for me to sell that way because I avoid my crops rotting or deteriorating and this way I earn money instantly,” she explains.  They also feed their animals, calves and pigs, on the community’s open fields and pasture lands.  She raises these animals to fatten them up and sell after about four or five months; she sells them head by head for about 100 soles.  During December and January she sells them at higher prices because of Christmas and New Year.

Francisca sees herself in the future as a wholesaler selling vegetables, leafy vegetables and tubers at wholesale not only in the city of Tarma but she also plans to go to other cities.  She knows that prices outside the city will be more convenient.

With your support she’ll be able to access MFP loan #13 so she is firm in her determination to make her installment payments according to the established payment plan.  She also comments that sharing interests and goals is what she likes best about her communal bank.  “I’m preparing for the May potato planting so will buy sacks of manure and fertilizer,” she states.  According to her calculations, Francisca will invest 1200 soles approximately.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
La Alegría se llama el comité formado por 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 9no. Ciclo. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa, tratan de que por medio de su trabajo puedan salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común.
Una de las miembros es la señora Paulina, ella por medio de la peluquería que tiene ayuda a su familia con todo lo que ellos necesitan. Su negocio, sumado a su trabajo y buena atención hace que le vaya muy bien y genere buenos ingresos. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de kiva y de la fundación. .
Desea comprar los insumos indispensables para su salo, como ser: tintes, sprays, tijeras, peines, batas para los cortes y otros. Agradece de antemano a kiva y también a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
This committee composed of 16 women working in their 9th cycle is called “La Alegría.”  They work together and in a mutually supportive way in the program.  They try through their work to help their families get ahead.  They all carry out fundraising activities and help each other reach common goals.

One of the members is Paulina who helps her family with everything they need through her beauty salon.  Her business added to her work and the good service she provides, have resulted in her doing very well and earn good income.  She wants to continue investing in her business so is asking for help from Kiva and the Fundación.

She wants to buy indispensable supplies for her beauty salon like: hair coloring, sprays, scissors, combs, client gowns for haircuts and others.  She thanks Kiva and the Fundación ahead of time for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Araceli Asuncion

texts.es: La señora Araceli Asunción empezó con un pequeño negocio vendiendo únicamente golosinas y otros productos con las utilidades del mismo negocio fue invirtiendo ahora vende otra variedad de productos, también los financiamientos de fundación león 2000 han sido de mayor importancia porque cuenta con mayor inventario. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, refrescos, huevos, leche, fideos y sopas.
texts.en: Araceli Asunción started her business selling just snacks and other products.  She reinvested profits from the business and now she sells a variety of products.  Loans from Fundación León have also been of major importance because she now has more inventory.  The reason for the loan she’s taking out is to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, milk, noodles and soups.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber, varnish, paint, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa del Sol” es D. la ciudad D. Asunción,  se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa D. Mujeres Emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas el cual las ayuda en los objetivos que tienen.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Mirtha, quien por medio D. la venta D. quesos ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, sumado a esto el sacrificio y las horas D. trabajo que ella invierte. Nos comenta que hace un tiempo se dedica a ello y que le ha ayudado mucho, es por eso que le gustaría seguir en lo que hace y D. ser posible ir creciendo más y más.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. kiva, para la compra D. quesos en cantidad, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda para abaratar costos y que tenga mayor ganancia. Mirtha, al igual que sus amigas, está muy agradecida a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
The “Villa del Sol” committee is in the city of Asunción.  It’s in its fourth cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras Program.  All of the members carry out productive activities which help them reach their goals.

One of the members is Mirtha who has raised her children by selling cheese added to the sacrifice and hours of work she expends.  She comments that she’s been doing this for some time now and it has helped her much which is why she’d like to continue doing what she does and if possible grow more and more.

She’s asking for help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy cheeses in quantity which will help a lot to lessen costs and increase her profits.  Mirtha, like her fellow members, is very grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy cheese for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco José trabaja en la alcaldía, desde hace unos 10 años, se desempeñaba como guarda de seguridad pero por su buena labor y cumplimiento de sus obligaciones lo promovieron a responsable de cementerio ahora devenga un salario mejor. El quiere realizar este crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, arena entre otros. Desde hace tiempo Francisco quería hacerle estas mejoras a su vivienda que son necesarias. Sueña con seguir con salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Francisco José has worked for city hall for about 10 years.  He used to work as a security guard but thanks to his good work and responsible attitude he was promoted to cemetery supervisor and now earns a better salary.

He wants to take out this loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks and sand, among other.  For some time now, Francisco has wanted to do some needed home improvements.  He dreams with staying in good health to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité surge gracias a la ayuda que otro comité les dio, en total son 15 mujeres que se unieron con el propósito de mejorar sus vidas, ya que quieren un mejor estilo de vida para sus familias, ellas son mujeres sacrificadas y muy luchadoras.
Una de ellas es la señora Liz, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, calzados, sabanas, frazadas y demás. Comenta que le va muy bien en su microempresa por lo que le gustaría poder seguir en el, es por ello que solicita el crédito para  la compra de esos productos que ella vende, como ser: prendas, calzados, sabanas, frazadas y otros.
Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues le será de mucha ayuda en su microempresa, pues este es el medio de subsistencia de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
This committee arose thanks to help they got from another committee.  Fifteen women in total joined together to improve their lives since they want a better standard of living for their families; they are very self-sacrificing and hardworking.

One of the women is Liz.  She sells all sorts of products like clothes, shoes, sheets, blankets and more.  She comments that she does well in her micro business so would like to continue in it and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy the products she sells, which are: clothes, shoes, sheets, blankets and others.

She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they give her because it will be of much help for her micro business because this is the source of support for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, sheets, blankets and others.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es: Vidalina de 45 años de edad, convive hace 20 años con Crisólogo, su pareja. Ambos vieron nacer 3 hijos que ahora tienen 15, 11 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en un hogar propio en el distrito de La Unión. Vidalina se encarga de producir vegetales, tubérculos y hortalizas en sus terrenos agrícolas.  Desde niña, la agricultura ha sido la actividad económica que la vio crecer y desarrollarse. Ahora que encabeza una familia continúa con las labores. “Depende como trabajes, en mi caso las arvejas son las más rentables, cada 3 o 4 meses estamos cosechando y vendiendo, además el rondo (variedad de arvejas) es bien solicitada y su precio nos conviene”, comenta. Muchas veces el factor humano ha sido el principal problema dentro de su actividad, inconveniente que ha superado con la contratación de operarios a los que paga diariamente. Al mismo tiempo, Crisólogo aporta otros ingresos con su trabajo de mecánico en el taller instalado en su propio hogar. Vidalina espera darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, para ello con sus ahorros invertirá en la educación de sus hijos, así como en la remodelación de su hogar. Por su parte proseguirá con sus labores con la meta de expandir sus terrenos y su producción. Éste sería su préstamo número 2 de MFP, que gracias a su ayuda podrá obtener. Por esa razón se compromete a pagar las cuotas en su debido tiempo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Ángeles de La Unión 2”, menciona que le agrada ser parte de ese grupo por la unión y apoyo entre todos. Con el capital, Vidalina podrá adquirir media bolsa de semillas de arvejas que cuesta 250 soles, con lo restante comprará sacos de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Vidalina, 45, has lived with Crisólogo, her partner, for 20 years.  They have three children who are 15, 11 and 7 years old now.  This family lives in their own house in La Unión District. 

Vidalina grows vegetables, tubers and leafy vegetables on her farmland.  Since childhood farming has been the economic activity she was born into and grew up with.  Now, she heads a family that continues with the same work.  “According to how the work takes place, peas are my most profitable ones; we harvest and sell about every 3 or 4 months.  Besides, the Rondo variety of pea is very sought-after and its price is advantageous for us,” she comments.

Often the human factor has been the main problem within her activity, an inconvenience she’s overcome hiring day workers that she pays daily.  At the same time, Crisólogo contributes other income working as a mechanic in a shop installed at home.

Vidalina hopes to provide her children with a better quality of life and uses her savings to invest in their education and to remodel her home.  On her part, she will continue with her work with the goal of expanding her fields and her production.

This would be MFP loan #2 that thanks to your support she hopes to obtain.  Because of this she commits to make her installment payments at the proper times.

She belongs to the “Los Ángeles de la Unión 2” communal bank.  She mentions that she’s pleased to be part of this group because of their unity and support among them.  Vidalina will be able to use the capital to buy half a sack of pea seeds that costs 250 soles and will use the rest to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy a sack of pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es D. la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo, son en total 15 mujeres quienes se   fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas, tanto social como económicamente,. Ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras.
Una D. ellas es la señora Liz, quien por medio D. la venta D. prendas ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios, para que D. esa forma pueda darles un mejor estilo D. vida y evitar que ellos pasen por las mismas privaciones por las que ella ha pasado. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora, luchadora y muy sacrificada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. verano, pues se acerca esa estación y quiere estar preparada para la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are 15 women who have set their main goal as being the growth of each and every one of them, both socially and financially.  They are well known in their town for being very hard-working, tenacious and entrepreneurial women.

One of the women is Liz who, through her clothing sales business, has been able to proviD. for her family and cover their daily expenses so that she can give them a better standard of living and avoid them having to suffer the same hardships she had to.  She describes herself as a very hard-working, tenacious and self-sacrificing person.

Liz is requesting this loan to buy summer clothing as this season is approaching and she would like to be prepared to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for resale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy trabajadora tiene dos oficios el de pintor donde realiza su trabajo en las construcciones y refaccion cobrando por metro cuadrado y el otro oficio de electricista y trabaja en las construcciones  y arreglos domiciliarios, siempre se sostuvo de esa manera, el es separado y su esposa e hijos se fueron de su lado, ahora el emprende solo y la cotidianidad de la vida hace que solicite un credito para la construccion de su vivienda, porque ahora vive en la casa de su sobrino y necesita salir para poder vivir independientemente. En consecuencia el credito le ayudara en gran medida para poder pagar de una forma mas holagada, de todas formas el cliente tuvo ya otros creditos en la institucion donde respondio de forma regular y en esta oportunidad, el cliente se beneficiara con con cuotas mas del alcance de su bolsillo y asi poder tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en: This client is a very hard-working person who has two jobs.  He works as a painter on building jobs and refurbishing jobs, charging by the square meter, and also works as an electrician, working on building jobs and carrying out repairs in people's homes.  He has always supported himself in this way.  He is separated as his wife and children left him.  Now he gets by on his own and is requesting a loan to build a house because right now he lives in his nephew's home and he needs to leave so that he can live independently.  This loan will help him a lot as he will be able to pay it off more comfortably.  The client has already received previous loans from the institution and repaid them regularly.  On this occasion, he will benefit from repayments which are more within his reach and, as a result, he will be able to own his own home.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Chixacol Group

texts.es:
El señor Felipe es casado, tiene 52 años D. edad, cursó los 2 años D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 4 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica a comercio a la venta D. ropa nueva, pantalones, playeras, etc., como también se dedica a atender una tienda en general.cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra D. producto D. tienda, ya que quiere ampliar este negocio, comprando: golosinas, aguas gaseosas, jugos, fideos, y entre otros. Espera ver en el futuro un negocio granD.. Los demás integrantes se dedica a diversas actividades: crianza D. animales, venta D. pantalones, y a la atención a tienda D. consumo diario.
texts.en:
Felipe is 52 years old and married.  He studied for two years at elementary school.  He has five children, four of whom are in school.  His business is selling new clothing: pants, t-shirts, etc.  He also runs a general store.  He has the support of his wife.

Felipe organized a group so that he could request a loan which he will use to buy products for his store as he would like to expand this business.  He will buy candies, soda, juice, noodles and other products.  He hopes to have a large business in the future.  The other members of the group work in different businesses such as raising animals, selling pants and running a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products for his store

loans.name: Walter Humberto

texts.es: Walter es un padre soltero que vive con su madre y su  menor hijo de siete años de edad en Ica Perú,  empezó su negocio en el año 2008 formando su propio Taller de cerrajería. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y 6 días a la semana, recibiendo ayuda de su  familia. Anteriormente Walter ha obtenido un créditos. Con el préstamo de 1,000.00  soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Walter podrá comprar materiales para su taller de cerrajería. También su crédito permitirá a Walter  pensar en el futuro y sueña con ampliar su taller de cerrajería y así tener mayor ingreso económico para solventar a su madre y a su hijo. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y  que podrá asumir una nueva responsabilidad pagando  cumplidamente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Walter is a single father living with his mother and 7-year-old son in Ica, Perú.  He started his business in 2008 establishing his own metal shop.  He works about 8 hours daily six days a week; his family helps him.  Walter has had one previous loan.

With the 1000 soles he will get thanks to Kiva, Walter will buy supplies for his metal shop.  The loan will also allow Walter to think of the future and he dreams with enlarging his shop to earn higher income to support his mother and son.  His credit advisor thinks that he’s an excellent client and that he’s able to assume a new responsibility and to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his metal shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 15 mujeres, que se pusieron como objetivo principal obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias e hijos, pues no quieren que pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones. 
Una de ellas es la señora Gladys, quien se dedica a la costura, trabajo gracias al cual ha logrado mantener a su familia y a mantener su casa. Comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos con los cuales cumplir, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y otros, los cuales son indispensables en su trabajo.
Ella al igual que las demás miembros agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues el crédito les será de mucha ayuda en sus objetivos.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are a group of 15 women who set themselves a main goal of making more income so that they are able to help their families and children as they don't want them to suffer any hardships.  

One of the members of the group is Gladys.  Her business is sewing.  Thanks to her work, she has managed to support her family and her household.  She says that her work is going very well as she always has a lot of orders to fill.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, threads, needles and other items which are essential to her work.

In common with the other members of the group, Gladys thanks Fundacón Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing as the loan will be very helpful to them in achieving their goals.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Susana Trinidad

texts.es: La señora Susana Trinidad es bibliotecaria del colegio, también recibe una pensión por parte del Seguro social y trabaja para una organización no gubernamental dando clases de manualidades varias y su esposo es obrero de trabajos vaR. y trabaja de forma independiente. Ella es una persona muy responsable y se compromete a pagar las cuotas de este crédito que lo solicita para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, entre otros. Su sueño o meta del es mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Susana está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Susana Trinidad is a school librarian and also receives a Social Security pension; she also works for a nongovernmental organization giving crafts classes and her husband’s a laborer working independently at various jobs.

She is a very responsible person who commits to make this loan’s payments.  She is requesting it to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.  Her dream or goal is to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Susana is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and sand, among others.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es: Claudia, una joven de 23 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, casada , tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad esta en primer grado de primaria, ellas es muy emprendedora y activa a pesar de  su corta edad, es dueña de una pulpería, la cual ella se hace cargo desde hace tres años, este negocio ere de su tía y ella le ayudaba a atender una tienda de abarrotería fue adquiriendo experiencia pero su tía se fue a vivir a Costa Rica y le dejo a ella la tienda de abarrotería desde entonces ella sea hecho cargo y es dueña de ese negocio. Ella vende sus productos el mercado de la terminal de Buses de León. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceite, maíz,vegetales,frutas productos enlatados, pollo, cosméticos, productos de limpieza, gaseosas, jugos, leches, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener su abarrotería surtida de productos que son de muy demandados por su clientes . Una de sus metas es estudiar Enfermería ya que ella dice que no solo quiere ser comerciante si no también convertirse en una enfermera profesional que tenga su negocio prospero y estable para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young woman of 23 who lives in the city of León.  She is married and has a 6-year-old son who is in his first year of elementary school.  Claudia is a very entrepreneurial and active woman.  In spite of her young age, she is the owner of a grocery store which she has been running for three years.  This business used to belong to her aunt and she used to help her serve in the store.  She gained experience and when her aunt went to live in Costa Rica she left her the grocery store.  Since that time, Claudia has been in charge and is the business owner.  She sells her products in the market at the bus terminal in León.

Claudia requested this loan to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, corn, vegetables, fruit, canned goods, chicken, cosmetics, cleaning products, soda, juice and milk.  This investment will help her to keep her grocery store stocked with products which are in great demand with her customers.  One of Claudia's goals is to study nursing as she says that she doesn't only want to be a shopkeeper but would also like to become a professional nurse who has a thriving and stable business so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, corn, vegetables, fruit, canned goods, chicken, cosmetics, cleaning products, soda, juice and milk

loans.name: Isabel Paula

texts.es: Isabel empezó su negocio en el año 2008 dedicándose a la venta de bebidas como emolientes, cebada, raspadilla. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y 7 días a la semana, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio Ica Perú. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y económicamente independiente.  Anteriormente Isabel ha obtenido un crédito. Con el préstamo de 1,000.00 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Isabel puede comprar  insumos para su negocio  de bebidas, ya que se acerca la temporada de verano. También su crédito permitirá  a Isabel al pensar en el futuro y sueña con terminar de construir su casa propia ya que Isabel es una mujer luchadora emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y pagará cumplidamente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Isabel started her business in 2008, selling beverages such as soothing teas, barley drinks, and shaved ice. She works 6 hours every day, 7 days a week. Her business is located in her own residence in Ica Peru. She has her children's help. They are grown and financially independent. Isabel took out a loan previously. With the 1,000.00 soles she will receive thanks to Kiva, Isabel can buy materials for her beverage business, since summertime is approaching. The loan will also allow Isabel to think about the future. She dreams of finishing construction on her own house. Isabel is a fighter who really wants to get ahead. Her loan promotor thinks she is an excellent client and she will make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beverage business.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old, and married with two adult children. Merlie is operating a business raising crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlie has been in her business for over 11 years and earns 11,637 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it.

In 2009, Merlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and have the ability to engage in business activities. Merlie is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Merlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Melvin owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been farming for five years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

Melvin is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Melvin has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is 58 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Alang-Alang, Aurora. Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Lelia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, which she has been doing for over 11 years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Lelia is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks to sell. In 2011, Lelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou is 51 years old and is a villager from Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a widow and has four children. She lives with her last-born child, 18, a fisherman, while the other three children are married and have started new homes. 

Mrs. Ou is in the business of selling mixed products from a store in her home. She sells goods like sweets, snacks, drinks, noodles, groceries, and other household products. Besides her retail business, she also helps her son in fishing on the boat along the Tole Sap River. Normally, this family is able to earn an income of $5.00 per day to satisfy their financial needs. 

Mrs. Ou would like to borrow some funds from HKL, a longstanding partner of Kiva, to purchase a machine (motor) boat to support the family’s fishing business. She hopes that this fund will help the family increase its income, which she will save to expand her retail business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a machine (motor) boat to support her family's fishing business.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (pictured above) and her husband, Ry, have been married since 1996 and have one son and two daughters, who are in school. The family is living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthy is a silk weaver, while her husband is a policeman. She is applying for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her brother, who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, to get to work.  
 
Because Chanthy’s brother commutes to work on his old motorbike and the motorbike breaks often, he spends a lot of money to repair it and it’s difficult for him to manage income. To help her brother, Chanthy decided to pay off her previous loan and is asking for another loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother to get to work.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a 59-year-old man who is married and has been blessed with seven children:
•	Gustaf, 28, is working as a motorbike taxi driver
•	Raju, 26, has graduated from Senior High School
•	Erick, 23, is working as a motorbike taxi driver
•	Yuna, 20, is married
•	Yudith, 17, is studying at Vocational school grade 2
•	Wilson, 15, is studying at Vocational school grade 1
•	Rivan, 6, is studying at Elementary School grade 1.

Yunus has been running a seamstress (tailoring) business for more than 20 years. He was taught by his father how to sew when he was young. With the skill he learned from his father, Yunus went to Jakarta to work for five years. With the experience from his previous employer in Jakarta, Yunus decided to return home and commence his own business.   

From the seamstress business, Yunus is able to cover his family's daily needs. He can sew coats, trousers, skirts, etc. Lately, Yunus cannot finish his customer’s order on time since some equipment is not working properly. 

Yunus is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to purchase a hemming machine, button maker machine, and other materials to support his business. Through the loan, Yunus wishes to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase a hemming machine, button maker machine, and other materials

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a rice farmer and her husband, Yum, is a soldier. 

They have been married since 1980 and have seven children, two sons and five daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home. Two are hired to sell clothes, and they get paid with fees. Two others are in school and another one sells ice-cream. The family is living in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Sok is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a cow to raise. She will be able to earn extra income from selling the cow when it grows big enough. 

Photo: Sok is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a farmer and she sells the fish that her husband Nhar catches. Her husband, Sophal is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a new boat to replace her husband's old one.

The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1975 and have three sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment, while another is a gas station attendant and others are in school.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat for her husband.

loans.name: Janbolat

texts.en:
Janbolat is father of one child and lives with his wife and son in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and looks after their son at home. 

Janbolat moved to the province center in 2008 and started his business. Now he has own joinery beside his house and makes woodenwares by subscription. He has enough tools. When construction materials' prices become high, the cost of disposal (of timber waste) rises too. He spends too much time when he goes to get orders off people. So he needs car in order to cut time and transport costs. He is hardworking and laconic man. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy a car to cut time and transport costs for his business

loans.name: Saveun

texts.en:
Saveun (in the photo) is 50 years old and her husband, Chuk is 51 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters. Three of them are married, one is a weaver, one is a construction worker and another attends grade 8.

Saveun and her husband are farmers. They grow rice, potato and sugar cane in the village where they live. Saveun is asking for a loan of $600 to assist in her farming business by buying seeds. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm, and weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly, 40, is married and has five school-aged children. She is from the village of Santo Domingo, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Dolly runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Dolly has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately P 5000 a month.

Dolly is requesting a new loan of P 7,000, that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, spices, noodles and candies for her store

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en:
Ulziibayar is a 38 year old single man. He lives in ger (Nomadic tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. 

He started his taxi service business in 2008 with his own car which he bought by working in a construction site. Since he bought it by working as a labourer, his car's condition is poor and he needs to replace and repair certain parts in order to run his business succesfully. His engineering knowledge is excellent that he will repair his car with his own hands. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I have a mission to open car workshop". He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Nurhayati, a 53-year-old lady, is married to Arif, a 55-year-old man. They are blessed with three children from their marriage:  Andri, 27 and married; Munarti, 21 and working in a bread company; and Torik, 18, studying at the 3rd grade of Senior High School.

Nurhayati is known as a hardworking woman in her family. She took over the responsibility to meet her family needs after her husband became ill and resigned from his job as a public minivan driver. Nurhayati commenced a kiosk business 14 years ago using her own capital. She sells daily needs items, fried cakes and cold instant beverage and she hires out a coconut rasping machine as well. 

Nurhayati is thinking of improving her business by adding more items to sell, but the limited capital that she has led her to seek a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on rice, coffee, sugar, milk, cigarettes etc. She hopes that TLM will assist her in improving her business through the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such rice, coffee, sugar, milk, cigarettes etc

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun (pictured above) is a tailor. She makes bags. She does not have her own business, she is hired to make bags and she gets paid a fee. Her husband, Sophin is a technician. They have been married since 2007 and have one young son. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Choeun is asking for a loan of $300 to build a restroom for her family use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family use.

loans.name: Ngim

texts.en:
Ngim, age 54, lives in a village located about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.  

She is a widow with five sons and two daughters.  Six of her children are married, five live in separated homes and the other lives in the family's home.

Ngim sells pork in her local market.  

She is in the process of building a new house. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to finish construction.

loans.use: to finish her new house.

loans.name: Duong's Group

texts.en:
Duong is a 63-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children.  They are from the Siem Reap province. 

Duong was chosen the leader of this group, consisting of four members.  Duong and her husband are in the same business, fishing.  They have been involved in this business since 2000, and this is their main source of income. Typically, they generate approximately $7.00 per day. 

They work hard and spend most of their time on the boat along the River of Tole Sap, in order to catch as many fish as they can. 

With the loan, Duong will buy fishing materials such as fishing net, lines and hooks.  

She hopes she will make more profit to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, lines and hooks.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian tent) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. 

Her daughter is a college student. 

Narantuya operates a clothes trading business.  She has been leasing a pavilion in the Erdene market since 1999.  She has a great amount of experience.  Her monthly sales are 1,500,000 MNT.  Half is net profit.

She is a gentle and hardworking woman who says, "Making stable and expanding my business will benefit my family's life."  

Narantuya needs a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak, age 24, is a widow with no child.  She lives with her mother in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyleak is a garment worker.  

She is asking for a loan of $500 to fill-in the land inside her house.  Tiny ponds need to be filled in.

loans.use: to fill-in the land inside her house.

loans.name: Hynoon

texts.en:
Hynoon is married and a very responsible father who provides for the needs of his family. 

Hynoon is requesting a loan of P 10,000 to buy materials that he needs in his auto shop, to better serve his clients.

Hynoon dreams that someday he will give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for her auto shop business.

loans.name: Adiyasuren

texts.en: Adiyasuren is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia.  His wife helps his business. He started his grocery retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Now he bought a car to run a taxi service and his wife runs a counter in the market. Now that his business is stable enough, he rented an extended counter. However, he hasn't enough supply to run the counter. Therefore, he is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more fruit from Ulaanbaatar at a wholesale price. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have baby coming therefore, I need to do everything I can in order to support my baby".

loans.use: To buy more fruit at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen is 25 years old and her husband, Pous is 28 years old. The have been married since 2003 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village about fifteen kilometers from the City.

Nen and her husband are farmers. They grow bean on their farmland in the village where they live. Nen is asking for her first loan in the amount of $100 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.  

Photo: Nen is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Bavuu

texts.en: Bavuu is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his elder son is college students and his younger daughter is school student. He started agriculture business in 2003 on his own land. Since vegetables are more profitable when retailed by himself, he moved to the center of the province and rented a counter in the market and sells vegetables. He needs a start-up cash in order to run a business. He is a sharp and diligent man who says"It is a big step for me. I calculated all the probable costs and risks therefore I am confident that it will succeed". He is requesting 1,300,000 MNT to rent truck for delivery his vegetables from Zavhan to Ulaanbaatar and sell them.

loans.use: To rent truck

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en:
Sivan is a scarf weaver (not pictured with her loom), while her husband is a motor taxi driver. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two sons - one is married and lives outside the family home and another one has full-time employment.  

Sivan is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son who has full-time employment to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando's family lives in the peaceful village of Baculod, Alcala. He is married to Leonor and together they raise three children. Primary source of income from the village comes from planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. Rolando had been in this business for almost two years. 

Due to financial instability, he is asking for a loan of P45,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Rolando hopes that with the help of this loan he could improve his farming practices and help increase crop production.

With his hard works and determination, He hopes that someday he could able to continuously finance the schooling of his children and improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mat is a father of two children. His children are eight years old and six years old. He has been selling vegetables since 2009. The business is going well but he wants to take out his second loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more and different variety of vegetables to sell from his stall. 

Already, the income from the business has enabled him to put tiling on the floors of the home so they are no longer made of dirt. His wife is a house maid but he hopes his business can grow enough so that someday she can work with him rather than have to clean houses. 

Additionally he hopes his children have the opportunity and the money to attend the university as he only was able to complete the ninth grade.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn (in the photo) is hired to wash dishes during ceremonies, weddings and other occasions. Her husband, Chea is a chef and does fishing when he is free. They have been married since 1995 and have four children who are attending school. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thoeurn is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Penh is 52 years old and his wife, Hing is 45 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children - three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives in separated home, one is a lathe operator, one is a weaver and one attends school and another is still young.  

Penh is a policeman. His wife is weaver and farmer. Penh is asking for a loan of $1,200 to assist in his wife’s farming business by buying water pumping because old one breaks and also buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide. 

Photo: Penh is not in his police uniform because he was free from work.

loans.use: To assist in his wife’s farming business by purchasing a new water pumping machine and also buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Namnama

texts.en:
Namnama is married and has six children. She is a homemaker, but does not just stay home. She has her own business. Namnama has been involved in fattening up livestock for ten years. She fattens up pigs and small livestock. Her husband helps her with this business and also in their farm. Together, they make a good living. Namnama needs to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock, but needs funds to do so.

She hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan and to have a better quality of living condition.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman. She has two adult children. She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and improve herself more every day. She sells cosmetics and clothes. She chose this work because she enjoys selling. She’s been working for about a year and earns P 260 per week. She is requesting a loan of P 7,000 to purchase dress, lotion, bags and accessories to have more additional income.

Editha’s main dream is to have a spa at home and to become a professional. She’s very grateful for the loan granted because she’ll be able to reach her goals with it.

loans.use: to buy dresses, lotion, bags and accessories for sale

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Most of Cambodian people who live in Siem Reap province like doing farming and fishing for their livelihoods. Among them, Mrs. Manh, a 49-year-old single woman, is also involved in fishing business, earning approximately $4.00 per day. Presently she is living with her nephews who always assist her in fishing. Manh intends to expand her fishing activities; she wants to buy an additional machine boat and some fishing tackles, through which she will be able to catch more fish for sale. She hopes that all Kiva’s lender will continue help support in her business.

loans.use: buy an additional motor boat and some fishing tackles.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 23 years old. Luzviminda provides boat-ride services from the mainland of Talibon to nearby islands. She has had her business for quite some time now. Luzviminda earns 10000 PHP per month with her business. She works hard to improve her business and send her children to school.

Luzviminda has requested a loan to repair her passenger boat and to purchase a new one. Luzviminda hopes for her business to grow more.

loans.use: to repair her passenger boat and purchase a new one

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is originally from Sto. Domingo province of Isabela and has been in the beauty salon business for more than 5 years. The welcoming environment of the salon pulls in customers of every ethnicity, from the lower class to the upper middle class. Edna says her clients come from as far as other communities to experience her services. Those services include, but are limited to hair extensions and styling. This loan will allow Edna to purchase materials needed for her shop, which will help her generate additional income. 

In the future, she hopes that someday she can expand her business to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy scissors, powder, clips and other items needed for her salon

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 45 years old. She has one child. She is married to a farmer who helps her in her business. She owns a small canteen and has requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make food for her customers. With the profits, she plans to save and pay school fees for her children. She would like to be a distributor for the customers who work far from her canteen.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her canteen (cafe) business

loans.name: Ma. Saturnina

texts.en:
Ma. Saturnina is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 young children. She and her husband have been running a fishing business in Nocnocan, Talibon for 10 years. This business earns 10000 PHP per month.

Ma. Saturnina has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and other materials. Ma. Saturnina hopes for this loan to help improve their fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and other materials

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Mrs. Nob is a loving mother of 2 school-aged children. She sells ice, biscuits, groceries and drinks from a general store next to her house. She typically earns around $4.00 each day from this business. She also gets an income from husband who provides motor-taxi service to the provincials. Nob wants her husband make more income by starting provide Tuk Tuk service instead of motor-taxi service. It’s better because he will be able to charge a higher price for this new service. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of $500 to buy a trailer that can be connected to the motorcycle to support her husband’s business. She will save money to expand her house if she is able to gain more income from the business.

loans.use: to buy a trailer.

loans.name: Peov

texts.en:
Peov sells bananas and coconuts at home. Her husband invests with his neighbors to cut trees as firewood and gets paid with fees. He now wants to run business independently, so Peov is asking for a loan in the amount of $800 to buy table saw for her husband.

The couple lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have one young son. 

Photo: Peov and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a table saw for her husband.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech is 37 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by fishing with her husband along Tole Sap River, one branch of Mekong River. This couple tries hard in order to raise their children, some of whom are working to help the family’s condition. Through fishing, Pech and her husband can generate a profit of $8.00 per day. Pech said that some of her fishing materials are very old and ruined, which have a bad effect upon her daily income. And now she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy fishing tools and a machine boat. With the increase in income she’ll earn, she will save it to open a general store for her daughter selling mixed products to the people in the community.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools and a machine boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and seasonings to cook and sell more food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts of her motorcycle

loans.name: Chinrattana

texts.en:
Chinrattana (pictured above) and his wife, Srey have been married since 2003 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. 

Chinrattana is a clerk, while his wife is garment factory worker. He is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to build a brick room under his house and build a restroom for his family's use.

loans.use: To build a brick room under his house and build a restroom for his family's use.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 13, 6 and 3. Cristina's husband is an NGO employee.

Cristina has a tricycle transportation business. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She does her best to support her family.

Cristina requested a loan to repair her tricycle and purchase new tires. Cristina hopes to be successful with her business.

loans.use: to repair her tricycle and purchase new tires

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a widow with two children; one son and one daughter.  The son is in full-time employment and the daughter is in school. The family lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. 

Chanthou has full-time employment with an NGO in Phnom Penh.  She is asking for another loan of $500 to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is 36 years old and married with two daughters. Her children are 11 years old and seven years old and are in the sixth grade and the first grade. She has been selling clothes on credit for two years. 

This job is important because it enables her to make income to buy food for the family. Her husband's income is only enough to pay for school fees for the children. She likes the business because she enjoys meeting the clients. 

Currently she doesn't have many competitors so she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to buy more clothing to resell to her customers in hopes of growing the business.  

Eventually she would like to also start selling electronics on credit to customers because it has higher profit margins than clothing. She wants her family to always have enough income to send the children to school to get a good education.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to resell on credit to customers.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is an electrician, while his wife, Vanna is a garment worker.  They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City. They have only been married since 2011 and have no child yet. 
 
Chantha is asking for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to get to work because he commutes to work by taking a taxi often. Taking a taxi to work is expensive for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Chhi's Group

texts.en:
This group has four members. They are residents of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. One of them, Mrs. Chhi, a 41-year-old widow woman, is the leader of this group. She is in the business of selling fish, while the other 3 are in the fishing business. Currently, Chhi is living with 3 single children, one of whom helps her sell fish in a local market that is located in Chong Khneas commune. From this business, she can earn an income of $4.00 each day to raise her family but it seems barely enough for the expenses. 

Mrs. Chhi wants to buy more fresh fish and more stock of dried fish for continual sales in the future. That is why she looking for funds in the sum of $200 from HKL to supplement her existing capital and to purchase her merchandise. She hopes to gain more income by using these funds.

loans.use: to purchase fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Merta Jati Group

texts.en: To continue her business, Ni Putu needs a new loan to purchase a new sow. Although the last loan was not as expected, she's not giving up and continues to run the business.Her family, especially her husband, supports her and he always helps his wife to run the business. They hope that this time the business can run well and they can earn some profit. Ni Putu has a dream: to be able to renovate their house from the profit.

loans.use: to buy a sow.

loans.name: Karypbubu

texts.ru: Карыпбубу 53 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей, младшие из которых школьники. Единственный сын Карыпбубу - Улан инвалид, но он прилагает все усилия для помощи матери в ведении хозяйства. В 1985 году, в поисках источника финансирования своей семьи, Карыпбубу начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Карыпбубу использовала стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карыпбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов для откорма и перепродажи. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Карыпбубу планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Karypbubu is 53 years old, married and has six children, the youngest still in school. Karypbubu's only son - Ulan is disabled, but he does his best to help his mother around the farm. In order to create a stable financial base for her family, Karypbubu started a livestock and produce business in 1985. She used her starting capital of 5,000 com (KGS) to purchase cattle and has developed her farm to yield a profit of 5,000 som (KGS) monthly. In order to further grow her herd, Karypbubu has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use the loan to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. In the near future, using the profits from the loan, Karypbubu is planning to purchase more animals for her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он занимается предпринимательством, то есть продажей сладостей более 12 лет. Ему в данном бизнесе помогает супруга, которая очень хорошо знает технологию приготовления всех видов сладостей. У него большая семья, чтобы прокормить большую семью одним бизнесом не возможно и поэтому он дополнительно работает жестянщиком. Данное ремесло он унаследовал от отца. Султонкул запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Sultonkul is married and a loving father of three children. He has been selling sweets and cakes for the last 12 years at the local market. His spouse helps him and she is very knowledgeable in the techniques of making sweets of different varieties. Since they have such a large family the sweets business is not enough and Sultonkul supplements the family's income using his metal working business. He has learned the metal working trade from his father. Sultonkul is requesting this loan to expand his business and would like to thank in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Poch, 52, a responsible mother of 9 children, has been living in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Presently 3 of her children are married and live independently in their new homes. She is engaged in the fishing business to help her husband in earning an income. She normally earns approximately $4.00 each day.  She also gets income from her son who always helps her in fishing. Her husband provides a ferry boat service to the people inside and outside the commune. 

Poch needs some funds to supplement her present capital in order to purchase an additional ferry boat for her son to start providing the same type of service. She is very grateful for the quick response and good treatment of Kiva’s funders.

loans.use: to purchase an additional ferry boat.

loans.name: 0402017-Liên Minh-Hoằng Trường Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thư operates a food stall where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell. Thư has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thư is 47 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

She is the leader of a five-member group, the 0402017-Liên Minh-Hoằng Trường Hoang Hoa solidarity group. In 2010, Thư joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Thư has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thư hopes to maintain a successful business, make enough money to provide for her kids, and be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old. She has eight children: five were able to finish the secondary level of education; her sixth child, Jaypee, is 15 years old and has stopped attending high school because of financial difficulties; while Corazon, 11 years old, and Michelle, 8 years old are both studying in the primary level. 

Corazon is a vendor of native cakes which she sells in the public market of their town of Naguillan, Isabela. She cooks and sells her native cakes and is doing her best to develop the business to be able to generate a higher income for the education of her two younger children. She is hoping that somehow, through her business, she can increase her standard of living.

Corazon is requesting a loan of P 7,000 as additional working capital in the production of her native snacks. She further said that “in every sacrifice, there is a prize.” She is hoping that her prize will be enough to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: 0404009-Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hộ operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell.

Hộ is 45 years old and she is married and has 4 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 0404009-Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Hộ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hộ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hộ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hộ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to maintain her fishing boat to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: 030202-Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in the future.

Tuyết is 42 years old and she is married, with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030202-Tây Hải-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 010308-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Dung is 30 years old and she is married and has 3 children.  She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 010308-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to buy a new motorbike, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Siluman Nopar Group

texts.en:
Dewi is pictured above standing in the middle and holding the bin of "salak" (snake skin fruit). She has been selling local seasonal fruits for the past 10 years. She is 33 years old and married with three children. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she will use it to purchase a larger quantity of next season's fruit to sell to customers. 

This business is special to her because her parents also were salesmen and now her husband sells fruit with her. The income from their business provides enough money to pay for their home to live in and school fees for the children.  She hopes that they will always have enough money to allow their children to accomplish their goals.

Other group members will use their loans for selling bananas, selling mobile phone minutes, and selling snacks.

loans.use: to pay for next season's fresh fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the village of San Manuel. She is 44 years old. Delia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Delia operates her husband's furniture manufacturing business. They sell general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Delia is requesting a new loan of P 13,000, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand their product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials need in her business

loans.name: Eshmat

texts.ru: Эшмат проживает в районе Гиссар. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Его старший сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Эшмат занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа быка и телят.
texts.en: Eshmat lives in the Gissar region. He is 42 years old, married and has eight children. His oldest son is working in Russia. Eshmat himself has raises cattle for a living for the last 10 years. He is requesting this loan to purchase calves and a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and calves

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She raises pigs to earn a living. She also supports her husband in managing their tricycle transport business. Linda works hard to improve her hog-raising business and expand her piggery. She requested a loan to purchase pig feeds and also tricycle spare parts. Linda hopes to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and tricycle spare parts

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 29 years old.  To earn a living he sells clothes and shoes.  He has been in the business for ten years.  He also practices livestock farming for extra income.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable because his business has improved. 
 
Benedict has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Trakash

texts.ru: Тракаш женат имеет семерых детей. Более 30 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Он хочет расширить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи. Тракаш раньше кредитовался  в  «ИМОН Интернэшнл» и на полученный займ купил корову и овцу. Теперь он хочет снова получить займ для покупки двух голов крупного рогатого скота. А еще хочет использовать часть займа для покупки семян пшеницы и ячменя для посева. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Trakash is married and has seven children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 30 years.  His wife helps him in this business.  He wants to expand his business and improve his family's well-being.  Trakash had previously obtained a loan from "Imon International" and used it to buy a cow and a sheep.  Now, he wants to obtain another loan to buy two heads of cattle and to use part of the loan to buy wheat and barley seeds for sowing.  He hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
46-year-old Elpedia makes a living through food vending. She makes rice and banana cakes, camote cue (sweet potato) that she sells to the people in her community. Her husband works as a driver and farmer. Elpedia also helps in planting rice on their land.

Elpedia has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers, and ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and rice. Elpedia hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers, and ingredients, such as flour, sugar, oil and rice

loans.name: Ferdinard

texts.en:
Ferdinard is 38 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he sells household goods such as jugs, basins, buckets and plates.  He also does farming for extra income.
