Previously, he used to operate a butchery.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how manage his business and save his money. 

Ferdinard hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy jugs, basins, buckets and plates.

loans.use: to buy jugs, basins, buckets and plates to sell.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.ru: Донёр занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 10 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он имеет 0, 83 гектар земли и там выращивает пшеницу и зерно. Кроме этого он занимается строительством. Принимает заказы на свободное время и зарабатывает денег на содержании семьи. На полученные доходы хочет ремонтировать свой дом и улучшить условия жизни. Донёр запрашивает займ расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Donyor has been involved in growing wheat for over ten years.  He is married and has one child.  He owns 0.83 hectares of land, where he grows wheat and grains.  Besides this business, he is also involved in construction work.  He fills his free time with construction orders and earns money to support the family.  He wants to use planned profits to repair his house and improve living conditions.  Donyor is requesting this loan for business expansion.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 47 years old.  He is married and has two children who attend college.  With his family's support and encouragement, he has been managing his farming business well. He plants and harvests rice for future selling to the traders in the village. He has been cultivating his one-hectare rice field for five years. Danilo is not yet an expert in this kind of work and needs to improve his farming practices.

Danilo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming.  According to him, rice farming depends upon the climate and on how to manage the rice field well.   In the future, Danilo aims to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 24 years old and married. For a living, he runs a motorbike transport business. He has been in the business for three years. Even though he runs his business in a very competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good services.

Douglas hopes to own a vehicle for transport in five years. He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Islatkan

texts.ru:
Ислаткан родилась в Токтогулском районе, в с. Озгоруш (юг Кыргызстана). После окончания средней школы 1983 году, Ислаткан поступила в Ошский Педагогический институт. Но к сожалению, когда она училась в первом курсе, ее украли замуж (древняя традиция кражи невест просуществовала долгое время, но в сегодняшнее время не распространена и карается законом). По этой причине, ей пришлось бросить учебу и заниматься домашними делами.  В 1984 году Ислаткан родила дочку, а в 1986 году развелась с мужем и начала работать в Жалал-Абадской больнице санитаркой. В 1987 году Ислаткан попыталась обрести счастье во втором браке и родила сына и дочь. К сожалению, семейная жизнь не сложилась и в 2004, после развода, она с детьми переехала жить в город Карабалта. Чтобы прокормить свою семью, Ислаткан купила швейную машинку и начала шить матрасы, подушки и продавала на рынке оптом. Благодаря трудолюбию и упорству, бизнес Ислаткан пошел в гору и в 2008 году, она смогла купить квартиру в селе Калининское. К настоящему времени,  Ислаткан выдала замуж двух дочерей и женила сына, которые теперь живут отдельно со своими семьями.  
Энергичная Ислаткан и сегодня занимается пошивом и принимает заказы, приносящие ежемесячный доход в сумме 12,500 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ислаткан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку швейной машинки, и машинки - оверлок. Она планирует взять на работу двух помощниц, что позволит ей увеличить объем заказов. В будущем, Ислаткан мечтает открыть мини швейный цех.
texts.en:
Islatkan was born in the Toktogul region, in the Ozgorush village (south Kyrgyzstan). After finishing high school in 1983 Islatkan attended Osh Pedagogical Institute, but unfortunately after the first semester she was kidnapped for marriage (the ancient tradition of stealing girls for brides has lasted a long time but currently occurs rarely and is punishable by law). Since she had been married she had to quit college and became a house wife. In 1984 Islatkan gave birth to her daughter and in 1986 she divorced her husband and started to work as a nurse in the Zhalal-Abad hospital. In 1987 Islatkan found happiness in a second marriage and gave birth to a son and a daughter. Unfortunately in 2004 she divorced again and moved with her children to the city of Karabalt. To feed her family Islatkan opened a sewing business and has been making mattresses and pillows which she sells wholesale on the market. Because of her hard work and determination Islatkan's business has flourished in 2008 and she was able to buy an apartment in the Kalininskoe village. After her move Islatkan has married off all of her children, who now live with their own families.

The energetic Islatkan is still running her sewing business and takes in orders that yield 12,500 som (KGS) in monthly profits. To grow her business further she has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS). She is planning to use the money to purchase a new sewing machine and a serger/overlock machine. She is also planning to hire two seamstresses for her business which will allow her to take in more orders. In the future Islatkan dreams of opening a small sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase sewing and overlock machines

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 26 years and single. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Hamisi has operated a fish selling business for the past three years, selling to his neighboring community members. He faces a major challenge of low purchasing power, especially during the month of June and July. He dreams of establishing a food stall shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a stock of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a master tailor. He operates his shop in the market and is an expert in men's clothing.
With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and also hire a worker to assist him. This will allow him to finish the orders on time and earn him more income.

Bushra also sews clothes to financially support her husband. She sews clothes for her community ladies and earns good income due to her good quality work. The income she earns helps her pay school fees for her eldest daughter who is studying in a nearby school. Her youngest daughter is only 2 and half years old.  Bushra is confident about her husband’s business success.  He has operated his business for the past many years.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 29-year-old married lady.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  Besides, she does farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and save her money.  This is because she can easily access a business loan because she is a member of a group registered under Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loan.  

She has requested for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is engaged in vending chicharon (fried pork skin) in her village. She is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to be able to have additional capital to increase her daily income. She has been in the business for 23 years and she hopes that it will become better so that her income will increase.

Through the aid of a motorcycle, she is able to deliver her chicharon to some stores in their village and sometimes to nearby villages. According to Jovie, she has to perform her obligation as a good mother to her children by providing them with support for their education so that they have the opportunity for a better future. 

Jovie is 35 years old and is married to Jofel . They are living in Barangay San Manuel province of Isabela, and they are blessed with four children. Through the help of her brother-in-law, they were able to start their business. She hopes that someday, with the help of the loan, the business will expand and will help increase her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy skin of pork and cow for making chicharon for her business

loans.name: Simana W Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana W Group in Western Kenya! Gladylily is the facilitator of the Simana W group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gladilily takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gladilily had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gladilily was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladilily  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gladilily will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana W group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tumaini A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from  Tumaini A SHG Group in Western Kenya! Henry is the facilitator of the group. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Henry takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Henry had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Henry was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Henry and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Henry will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini A SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Henry is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cabbage, squash, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 34 years old and married with eight children, two boys and six girls, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 25 years, he has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality; during the dry, hot season, the supply of fish is low. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda is 43 years old, married and blessed with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a grocery shop.  He has five years of experience in the business.  He also does farming for extra income.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans, which has helped him to boost his business.

Ndunda hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 25 years old and married to his wife Metrine, who is a business lady. They have no children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport for the past one year with the monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. Geoffrey will use the loan to service his motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from his business, he will boost his wife’s business. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Riva is 28 years and married to his wife Asha. They have two boys, both of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, he has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market and in a shop to restaurant operators and town residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the month of June and July. Riva dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase fishing rods and a freezer to store fish. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing rods and a freezer to store fish.

loans.name: Toloso S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Toloso S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Ceciliah is the facilitator of Toloso S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ceciliah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ceciliah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Ceciliah was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ceceliah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ceciliah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Toloso S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lotion, shampoo, soap, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 43 года. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Ханифа занимается торговлей рядом со своим домом. Она занимается торговлей топлива. В этой области она 16 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения топлива.
texts.en: Hanifa lives in the Gissar region. She is 43 years old, divorced and has two children. Hanifa has been selling gasoline and stove fuel from her home for the last 16 years. She is taking out this loan to purchase a big batch of fuel wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 32 years old, married and has one child who is eight months old.  He offers services such as printing and photocopying to earn a living for his family.  He has been in the business for five years.  He runs his business in a competitive environment and he is able to retain his customers because of his good customer care.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care skills. 

Rodgers needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer for his business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 37 years old and a business man. He is married to his wife Dinah, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children ages 12, 6, and 2 years old. He has been a mason for the past 20 years with the monthly income of 6,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Philip is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy cement and bricks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes are to venture into a retail shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Wekelekha A Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wekelekha A Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Jackson is the facilitator of the group. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackson had a very good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wekelekha A Farmers group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Jackson is pictured in the photograph above with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a village store owner who has been managing her business for almost a year, which really helps her in meeting the needs of her children. She would like to borrow a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will to use to expand her business. She is planning to purchase additional merchandise for her store such as garlic, onions, bottled soft drinks, and canned goods. She will do her best to help her husband earn money for their immediate needs and education of their four children.

Elisa is 35 years old and married to her husband Isidro, a driver for a petron Company. They are blessed with four kids: Ariel, 14, already in grade six; Arnie, 13, grade five; Alvin John, 6, and Isidro Jr., 4. Despite the difficulties, they always do their best to be successful.

loans.use: To buy drinks, onion, garlic, and canned goods for her store.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 27 years and married to his wife Mwanakombo. They are blessed with two girls who both attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

For the past seven years, Omar has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the months of June and July.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Fazilat's Group

texts.en:
Fazilat is 46 years old, and married with four children. Three of them are boys, and a daughter who is the eldest one. Except her youngest son who is 6 years old, all the others are getting their education from a nearby school. Fazilat herself is a teacher and knows the importance of education very well. She wants her children to complete their education and become successful in life.

Fazilat's husband operates a grocery store in the market. Through his shop he sells daily use items like cooking oil, salt, and sugar at cheap rates to his clients. Fazilat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan he will increase the grocery stock for his shop by purchasing products like cooking oils, spices, and sugar that will allow him fulfill the client needs and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for many years and he is hopeful that an investment will help him get more established in his business.

Note: In the picture, Fazilat is the lady holding a book called Asasah passbook.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock such as cooking oils, spices, and sugar for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Stanely Gavole

texts.en:
Stanely used his first loan to rent more land for farming, and he also bought seedlings for planting. He got good harvest, with an income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES). Stanely paid his previous loan well and in good time.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will boost his wife’s business. His hopes to have enough money to educate his child and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has four children.  She has been farming since 2006.  She practices mixed farming.  She is able to farm well because the climate of her region is favorable for farming. She has benefitted from her group, Faulu Kenya because she has learnt new business ideas and is also now able to save her money.

Grace hopes to expand her farm so as to yield more produce.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy seedlings for cabbages, tomatoes and kales.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for cabbages, tomatoes and kales for her farm.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is 47 years old and has three children. He had worked abroad several years ago. He had saved enough capital to buy ample land for cultivation, so he decided to come back home and involve himself in a business. He plants rice as the source of his income. Paulino's wife is also involved in the hog raising business to increase the family's income. Income generated from the business was just enough to cover their expenses, especially in financing the education of their children.

Paulino now asks for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He wants to purchase these inputs for the development of his crop production.  With his patience and hard work, Paulino hopes to see all his children hold a degree and pursue their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia and her family are living a simple life in the village of San Manuel province of Isabela. She is married to Rodolfo, a tricycle driver. Their three children are all married: Precy, the eldest is 36 years old, a midwife graduate and now working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Efren, 32 years old, is a vocational course graduate, working in Qatar, and Roden, 30 years old, is a graduate of Police Technology. 

In order to earn their daily living, Rodolfo works as a tricycle driver, while Ignacia is working as a calamansi vendor. Calamansi is a citrus fruit native to the Philippines. They strive to work to sustain their daily needs because they do not want to depend on their children financially, since they all have their own families. Some of their income from their tricycle operation and vending business was invested in their piggery business as an alternative source of income. 

Ignacia is asking for a loan of P 18,000 that she will use for the continuous operation of their small businesses. They have been in business for 28 years and it has assisted them in sending their children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old.  He is a businessman and is married to Zipporah, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stock of sugar and wheat flour to add to his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar and wheat flour to add to his shop

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.ru: Рахмонкул начинал свою деятельность в сфере аграрном бизнесе. Он вдовец и имеет четырех детей. Он сам обеспечивает семью, и он всегда нуждается в поддержке в  воспитании детей. Рахмонкул хочет, чтобы его дети выросли воспитанными и образованными людьми и поэтому он усердно работает, чтобы устроить их в хорошие школы и университеты. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием пшеницы.  В сезон он получает хороший урожай и продает за выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, на полученную прибыль он планирует сыграть свадьбу сына.  Рахмонкул запрашивает займ для покупки семян и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Rahmonkul has been a farmer for the last 10 years. He is a widower and has four children. He raises his family all by himself and always needs help to take care of his children. Rahmonkul wants to see his kids grow up civilized and educated and he is working hard to assure that they attend the good schools and are able to go to college. He grows wheat on his farm and has been getting abundant harvests which he could sell for a good price. Rahmonkul wants to expand his farm and increase his profits, then use the money to organize a wedding for his son. He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in order to expand his business

loans.name: Tembelesia B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Tembelesia B Group in Western Kenya! Mildred is the facilitator of Tembelesia B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Mildred takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mildred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mildred and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Mildred will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Tembelesia group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Monica has been in business selling clothes at the market, on a retail basis, for the last 7 years. She works six days a week. She has requested  for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls materials to make clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothing materials. 

Monica and her family live in a rented house and have access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent, and her aspiration and goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy rolls of clothing materials (bitengi)

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert's primary source of income comes from rice farming. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice on his two-hectare rice field. Robert has three school-aged children and would like to provide them with a good education.

During the last harvest season in April, Robert was unable to harvest good crops due to a typhoon that had affected their area. He felt sad about what happened to his crops, but was still determined to provide to the needs of his family. 

In order to ensure good growth of his seedlings, Robert is now asking for a loan of PHP20,000 in order to buy the herbicides and pesticides (chemicals that are used to treat the herbs and pests that affect the seedlings' growth) that he will use in farming. He hopes to improve his crop and produce an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pesticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is taking another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 so he can boost his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase a shaving machine and shaving detergents. He thanks the Kiva lenders and Yehu for providing loans so he is able to improve his business and his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a shaving machine and shaving detergents.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 40 years old and married to Wairimu; they have six children. Besides farming as his primary activity, he also operates a retail shop in the area.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients, and this will be his first loan to buy salt, wheat flour, tea leaves and washing detergent for sale. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, David hopes to expand his retail shop to a wholesale one, make more profits and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy salt, wheat flour, tea leaves and washing detergent.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She farms to earn a living for her family.  The climate of her region is favorable for farming.  This has helped her to farm well.  She practices mixed farming; growing crops and rearing dairy cows. It has been 1 year since she started farming.
Dorothy hopes to expand her farm by 3 acres for more produce.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy seedlings for cabbages, kale, spinach, and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for cabbages, kale, spinach, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Hazel is a married woman with two children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like canned goods, bread and shampoo. Hazel also sells school supplies to the people in her community. Hazel earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. She works hard to improve her earnings.

Hazel has requested a loan to purchase canned goods, sacks of rice and soft drinks. Hazel hopes to venture into other types of business to augment her income.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, sacks of rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 27 years old and has an embroidery business. She receives orders from community members and earns money after completing them. She does this work to financially support her husband. Her husband is a cobbler by profession; he makes shoes on order. He has business contacts with many shoe-selling shops in the market, and he completes their orders to earn income for the family.
 
Naseem is the mother of two daughters. Both of them are young and haven’t started their education. She is also a very good mother and a wife, taking care of her family by fulfilling their needs.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's shoe-making business. With the loan, he will buy material such as leather and nails and a shoe polisher for making shoes in larger quantities to earn maximum profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past nine years and is very confident that an investment will help him make his family’s financial life easier.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and a shoe polisher for a shoe-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old and married with two school-aged children. Anita owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anita has been involved in her business for over 39 years and earns approximately 13,790 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  

Anita is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kav, 42, is a group leader in this team that consists of four members, three of whom work in fields related to the fishing business, while the other one sells merchandise. People in this group have different purposes in using this fund. 

Mr. Kav works on the River of Tonle Sap from Siem Reap province. He earns a living by catching fish from this river alongside his wife. Fishing provides the sole income for this family. Together, they typically earn an average of $8.50 per day through his business. Recently Mr. Kav has encountered difficulty because the machine of his fishing boat is old and breaks down too often, which affects his income. Thus, he decided to take out a loan from HKL, a L.-standing partner of Kiva to purchase a new machine to replace the old one. He is very happy and thankful to all Kiva’s lenders who kindly help him and his group members.

loans.use: to replace the machine in his boat.

loans.name: Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Akhter has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who has a business of sewing clothes. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine because his current machine doesn't produce good quality work and takes too much time to sew a single dress. The new machine will allow him to complete the orders on time and increase his profits. 

He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Akhter is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and that it will help him increase his sales and income.

Akhter is also a very talented seamstress; she sews clothes for her community clients and is an expert in ladies clothing. She is a very good housewife, too, and performs her tasks very well. 

Akhter is a new loan applicant; she hopes that it will result in good profits for her husband.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Akhter.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has operated her beauty salon shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 24 years old and married to Simon; they have one school-going child. She also plans to start selling shoes.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cosmetics for sale and to use in her business, and also to buy shoes for sale.

In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her salon and shoe business and become among the best business people in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Mwanakura

texts.en:
Mwanakura is 32 years and married to Hassan. She has three children: two girls and one boy, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a business of selling grocery items like potatoes, tomatoes and onions, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation from Mombasa town to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a fruit parlor in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu because of the availability of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Rahimkul

texts.ru: Рахимкул женат и имеет одного ребенка. Более 36 лет Рахмонкул занимается купле- продажей скота. За эти долгие годы он набрал богатого опыта и знает все слабые стороны бизнеса. В бизнесе помогает ему его любящая заботливая жена. Рахимкул хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия, чтобы жить в хороших условиях жизни. Рахимкул запрашивает займ для покупки стройматериалов на подстройки подсобных хозяйств и покупки скота для расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Rahimkul is married and has one child. For the last 36 years Rahimkul has been raising and selling cattle. Over the years he has gained a lot of experience and knows all of the pitfalls in the business. His loving and caring wife helps her husband with the livestock. Rahimkul wants to improve his living conditions and so to improve the quality of life for his family. Rahimkul is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to build new barns and sheds and to purchase additional animals for his herd. He is grateful to all of his lenders for their support and charity.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for new barns and animals for his herd

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is happy that he was able to make a lot of sales in his shop after he bought mobile phone accessories with his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings.  Now that there is high demand for DVD players, he has requested a loan  for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy DVD players.  He hopes to grow his business and open three other outlets in another region so as to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy DVD players for his shop.

loans.name: Imara

texts.en:
Imara is 42 years and married to Hassan. She has five children, three boys and two girls. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a grocery store, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes, four sacks of charcoal, and vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two crates of tomatoes, four sacks of charcoal, and vegetables.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells clothes (bitenge) at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years. She works six days a week. 

Monica has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy materials to make clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Her aspiration is to buy plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Mirzomutdin

texts.ru: Мирзомутдин проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Мирзомутдин имеет средне – специальное образование. Он плотник. Уже восемь лет как он занимается изготовлением мебели. Кредит берет для закупа шифера и досок, чтобы достроить навес.
texts.en: Mirzomutdin lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker and Mirzomutdin has a technical degree. He now works as a woodworker and has been making furniture for the last eight years. Mirzomutdin is requesting this loan to purchase eternit and wood for building a shed.

loans.use: to purchase wood and roofing materials(eternit) for a shed

loans.name: Beibithan

texts.en:
Beibithan is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is a teacher and his son goes to kindergarten. 

He started his transportation business in 2007 with his own van. He has already bought a house with the profits. His van is clean and customers were satisfied with the service. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to prepare his van for the Mongolian harsh winter. He is a strong and diligent man who says "Now that I bought a house I have a mission to expand my business." He is requesting 500,000 MNT to maintain his van.

loans.use: To maintain his van.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 and married to Hamadi. She has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated an ice-cream selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to establish a food stall business, cooking chapatis (flat bread) and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to establish a food stall business, cooking chapatis (flat bread) and beans.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is an embroidery expert. She started this business to financially assist her husband who sells clothes. He purchases clothes from a wholesale market in his city which is a big city, known for its textile industry, and then sells to his customers.

Shabana is the mother of 2 sons. Both of them stay at home and don’t study. She is a very caring lady and tries to give comfort to her family by her household work.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because she wants to expand her embroidery business. With the loan she will buy embroidery material such as beads, sketches and coloured threads in bulk. This will allow her to make beautiful-looking embroidered clothes and earn more profit by selling them. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about the success of her business after this loan investment.
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. During her previous loan, she established a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

Note: "In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Shabana".

loans.use: to buy embriodery material such as beads, color threads and sketches.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал женат и ответственный отец двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Более 7 лет он занимается купле- продажей обувей. Данный бизнес он унаследовал от своих родителей. В бизнесе ему помогает младший брат.  За товарами он ездит сам в город Бишкек и привозит модные и высококачественные обуви. Его торговая точка находится в центре вещевого рынка. Более 7 циклов кредитуется в ИМОН Интернэшнл и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Акмал запрашивает займ для расширения ассортимента товаров. Он заранее благодарит ИМОН Интернэшнл и КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en: Akmal is married and is a responsible father of two adolescent children.  He has been involved in buying and selling shoes for over seven years.  He inherited this business from his parents.  Akmal's younger brother helps him with the business.  Akmal himself travels to the city of Bishkek and brings in stylish and high-quality shoes.  His retail outlet is located in the center of the clothing market.  He has obtained more than seven loans from Imon International and has a good credit history.  Akmal is requesting this loan to expand his merchandise selection.  He thanks Imon International and Kiva in advance for the support.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Toloso B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Toloso B Group in Western Kenya! Grace is the facilitator of the Toloso B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Grace takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her children, ensure food security for her family, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Toloso B group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 26-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is dealing in cocoa buying and selling. He first accessed capital from money lenders. The main challenges faced by him include the fluctuation of prices in the market, inadequate capital to purchase more stock and high fuel costs. His personal goal is to build a permanent house for his family, and his business goals are diversifying his business and buying land to grow his own cocoa. Emmanuel wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is from the village of Benito in the northern Luzon province of Isabela. He is 47 years old and married. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns about P 35,000 per cropping.

Guillermo is requesting a new loan of P 35,000. This loan will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer to raise his crops.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 28 years and married to Salim. They are blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells fish which adds another source of income. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish, wheat flour and cooking fat oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish, wheat flour and cooking fat oil for resale.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is a farmer. When available from the rice field, she raises pigs and ducks at home to earn her living. Her husband is a cameraman and a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Lim is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his motor-taxi business more efficiently. By doing so, she will enable her husband to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Lim's husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and bread for resale.

loans.name: James Matheri

texts.en:
James used his last loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on his farm during the planting season. He harvested and it was very profitable. He paid the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be his eighth loan, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more seeds and fertilizer for this planting season.

In the future, James hopes to become among the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Apiya

texts.en: Apiya is 31 years old and lives with her father, sister and brother in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her sewing business in 2008 by renting a small space. Now her business is stable and she has one employee. She sews work clothes. Now that the mining business is booming in Mongolia, her business is going well; however, she is lacking equipment and staff. In order to improve her business, she needs a little support. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to buy more materials.

loans.use: To buy more materials.

loans.name: Erminio

texts.en:
Erminio is from the village of Isabela. He is 37 years old. He is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Erminio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns about P 30,000 per harvest.

His previous loan was used to purchase seeds, seedlings, young crops and fertilizer. Erminio is requesting a new loan of P 40,000. In the future, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow on his farm.

loans.name: Davlatbegim

texts.ru: Давлатбегим  жительница района Рудаки. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится в России на заработках. Сама она занимается шитьем национальных платьев у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Davlatbegim is a resident of the Rudaki district.  She is 27 years old and married.  Her husband is currently in Russia for work.  Davlatbegim is involved in sewing national dresses at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Planting and harvesting rice is what Modesto and his family rely on to survive in their daily living. He only earns an income twice a year during the harvest seasons of April and November. This income is insufficient for their needs, so his wife raises hogs for additional profits. The couple has to strive hard since they were blessed with nine children. Four of them attend school and the rest have settled into marriage. 

Modesto at this moment has insufficient funds for the maintenance of his rice field. He is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers to be used in farming.

He hopes to increase his crop production to save for the education of his children and to someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is 36 and married to Bakari. They have four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a fruit selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the lack of ready market to sell her products. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase crates of passion fruits and mangoes for making juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of passion fruits and mangoes for making juices for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Keziah, who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child, aged one year. He has been in the farming business for the past seven years with the monthly income of about KES 6,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Stephen will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy another piece of land. His hope and dreams are to export his farm produce, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 31-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He is faced with limited capital for expansion, inflation and high transportation costs. His personal goal is to educate his children and to build a good house. His business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Patrick needs the loan to buy sugar, salt and millet flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en: Jovito is 37 years old. He lives in La Sallette village, in the province of Isabela, with his wife and his child. By cultivating land on their farm, he produces corn and will sell it in the future. Jovito is a very patient and hardworking person. He needs a PHP 35,000 loan to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm. Jovito dreams that his business will expand to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Davgajamts

texts.en: Davgajamts is 25 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He started his meat and grocery retailing business earlier this year by renting a counter in a market. His business is going so well that his supplies are not enough to keep up with business. There are many buildings being built in a nearby area, which gives him an opportunity to expand his business. He is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to buy more vegetables and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is 46 and married with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation, which makes it difficult for her to sell clothes door-to-door year round. Mwanalima dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is employed at the factory. Her husband sells hand-made brooms at home. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Sothea is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to travel to sell brooms. By doing so, he can generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to travel to sell brooms.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison has been in the property business in Naivasha town for the last five years.  He is 34 years old, married to Purity, and they have one school-going child.  Besides the rental houses business as his primary activity, Harrison also practices dairy farming.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy dairy cows for raising and to sell the milk produced.

In future, Harrison hopes to have a big ranch and produce milk for distribution to dairy companies in Naivasha and Nairobi and become one of the leading dairy farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy dairy cow.

loans.name: Webanania Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Webanania Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Webanania group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Everlyne is a mother to two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Webanania group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Antoney

texts.en:
Anthony is a 40-year-old businessman, and he is married to Agnes who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged five and three years.  He has been in the sawmill business for the past six years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Anthony will use the loan to buy timber and a saw. 

With the anticipated profit he will expand his business. His hope and dreams are to buy a piece of land and plant trees which he will use in future for his business.

loans.use: To buy timber and a saw.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 46 years old. Mary Jane is married and has four children. 

To make a living, she is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Mary Jane has been in her business for over 2 years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a taking another Kiva loan to expand her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to add stock to her beauty salon business and to purchase hair oil products and a blow dryer machine. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs.  

Thanks to Kiva lenders and Yehu for providing loans to boost her business and change her living standards.

loans.use: to add stock to her business and to purchase hair oil products and a blow dryer machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 24 years.  He is 42 years old, married to Sara, and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for his grocery business.

In future, Peter hopes to own a lorry to transport his farm produce to the market, thereby increasing his income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his grocery business.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is 50 years old. She has studied until 8th grade and lives with her husband and 2 sons.

She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services to his passengers.  Her eldest son left his education after matriculation while the youngest one has completed until the intermediate level.  Both of them are looking for a job these days. Tasleem is hopeful that they will find a suitable job in the near future.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and earn more profits.

She has been operating her business for the past many years and her community ladies know her very well for her good quality work. She is confident that she will successfully be able to improve her business after the loan investment.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Tasleem.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 30-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for five years amidst challenges of price flactuation due to the current inflation in the country. His personal goal is educating his children and his business dream is a wholesale shop.

Peterson wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Bros, 39, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Bros is a blacksmith, and his wife produces brooms to sell. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Bros is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, he is able to save on transportation costs. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Angaza B Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Angaza B Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Josephine is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Josephine is a mother of one child. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Josephine had a good maize yield harvesting six and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Josephine was only able to harvest four bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Josephine will save for future use and invest in her business. 

In 2012, the members of Angaza B Farmers group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 30 years old and married to Bakari. They have three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of potatoes and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en:
Yarn, 29, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Yarn is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Yarn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. By doing so, she will save on transportation costs. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 4 years, William has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells hardware. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies and will help William to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. William hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya was born in 1958. She is married and has two daughters who are married and live on their own. Ofelya lives with her husband in the town of Ijevan. She worked as an accountant in one of Ijevan's factories for many years prior to its liquidation.

Since 2004, she and her husband have made a living selling bouquets and wreaths from a stall they rent in the town market. Thanks to the success of this business, Ofelya has been able to repair her house and pay for her daughters’ education and weddings. She likes her work because it allows her to hear many romantic stories related to her bouquets.

With her first Kiva loan, Ofelya bought a big lot of flowers for her business. With income from trade, she was able to enlarge and to repair her stand.

Now Ofelya is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy flowers, baskets, colored ribbons and wrapping paper in advance of the Christmas and New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to buy flowers, baskets, colored ribbons and wrapping paper in advance of Christmas and New Year’s holidays

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
This is Felicidad. She is 63 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Apolonio, a mason and a father to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Felicidad operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viand, a traditional Filipino dish, in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Felicidad hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration through the study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en: Xavier is a 24-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He currently sells shoes and he has been in business for one year. He faces challenges such as price fluctuations, theft, and high taxes, among other things. He wants to continue his studies at the university level and to educate his children. His business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Xavier wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 51, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Khim sells hand-made brooms, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Khim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to travel to sell the brooms. By doing so, he will generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to travel to sell brooms.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. For the past 6 years, Dan has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Dan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat for resale, and will help Dan to generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Dan hopes that in the future he will be able to open more branches of the same business. 

Dan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for resale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 46 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past four years, Peace has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens. To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 1, 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more feed for the chickens and will help Peace to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. 

Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the chickens,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long, 31, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Long is a construction foreman, and his wife is employed at a garment factory in the city. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Long is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction supplies to expand his construction business. By doing so, he will be able to generate more income. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies to expand the business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single parent with one child who is now studying in college. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a vegetable seller. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling. He is very hardworking person and Fehmida is very much sure that her husband will be able to improve his business condition after the loan investment.

She is a working lady who stitches clothes for her neighboring clients on order to financially assist her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She is the mother of three daughters and a son. Unfortunately, she couldn’t provide education to her children due to her poor financial situation.

Her eldest daughter is 18 years old and supports Fehmida in her sewing work.

Fehmida is hopeful that after the improvement of her husband’s business she will be able to save some profits for the marriage of her elder daughter.

She is a new loan applicant.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Fehmida.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Javzanhorol

texts.en:
Javzanhorol is 52 years old and lives with her granddaughter and grandson in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She started her grocery retail business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. She has many regular customers due to her good service and cheap prices. 

Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save some groceries in order to run her business successfully. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "I am happy that I can support my grandchildren. It makes me feel useful." 

She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru:
Аида родилась  и выросла в среднеобеспеченной семье.  После смерти отца она  вместе с семьей переехала в село Ак - Суу,  ближе к родственникам. После окончания школы, Аида поступила в Финансовый колледж,  но к сожалению,  не закончила его, так как вышла замуж.  Родив сына в браке, Аида развелась  и поселилась у своей матери.  Сегодня Аида является единственным кормильцем для своего девятилетнего сына и парализованной матери. Для того,  чтобы прокормить свою маленькую семью, Аида занялась торговлей продуктами питания.  Со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), она решила открыть маленький магазин на  территории собственного дома.  Сейчас  в товарообороте  в магазине Аиды около 30,000 сом,  и в ее планах - расширение бизнеса. Именно с этой целью, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.
