Za svoi 33 qoda on nauchilsya mnogomu, on rabotal v raznix mestax, on ochen trudolubiviy chelovek, qotov rabotat na luboy rabote glavnoye soderjat svoyu semyu. Uje 6 let kak on otkril svayo kafe gde sam je i rabotayet. Seychas on nujdayetstya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye stoli i stulya tak kak v techenii 6 let yego mebel isportilas uje. Chtobi nachat etot bizness yemu pomog yego dyadya kotoriy uje imel svayo kafe.
texts.en: Anar lives with his family in the Baku region.  He is married and has two beautiful children, one of whom attends a school.  Anar is 33 years old. He had learned a lot over his 33 years and worked in different places.  He is a very hardworking person, who is ready to do any work as long as he can support his family.  Anar opened his own cafe, where he also works, six years ago.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new tables and chairs because his furniture got worn over the last six years.  Anar's uncle, who also had his own cafe, helped him to start this business.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio's goal in life is to provide a better living for his family. To make a living, he raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice which he also sells. He has been growing rice since 2000. His family is not well-off and he relies on the income generated from the business. He needs to improve his crop production but he has insufficient funds to buy inputs. He is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seed for his farm.

Bonifacio is 44 years old and has four school-aged children. He usually pays P3,000 for their tuition fees. 

He wants to improve his farming practices to increase his earnings and thus provide a successful living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seed for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes/cloths to add to her business.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire, sans enfants.Elle vend des produits de beauté .Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la capitale et place les produits auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux à trois mois.Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices assez importants.Elle se prend en charge et s'occupe aussi de la scolarité de ses quatre petits frères.Elle sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter du lait de beauté, des parfum, des mèches et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est de s'implanter en centre ville en y ouvrant sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Aby is unmarried and without children. She sells beauty products. She gets her supplies from large stores in the capital, and sells them to her customers, who pay her after two or three months.

This business turns a rather high profit. She provides for herself and takes care of the school expenses of her four little brothers.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 300'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to buy beauty milk, perfumes, hair extensions, and various other products.

Her ambition is to open her own shop downtown.

loans.use: to buy beauty milk, perfumes, hair extensions, and various other products

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Гульнара родилась в Чуйской области, в селе Сокулук. Окончив среднюю школу, она приехала в город Карабалта и 1995 году поступила  в Карабалтинское медицинское училище по специальности фельдшер - акушер.  В 1998 году , Гульнара, окончив училище с красным дипломом (degree with distinction), устроилась на работу в  роддом медицинской сестрой. В 1999 году она вышла замуж за  Айбека, работавшего охранником на спиртзаводе, и в  этом же году родила сына.  В 2000 году  Гульнара со своей семьей переехала в село Полтавка, где муж нашел работу,  и в 2009 году у них родилась  младшая дочь. В поисках дополнительного источника доходов для своей семьи, в 2010 году Гульнара начала заниматься разведением скота, и в качестве старта она купила корову с целью получения прибыли от продажи молока и сметаны.  В целях расширения хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров и кормов. 
В будущем, Гульнара мечтает построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulnara was born in the Sokuluk village of the Chuy region,  She moved to the city of Kara-Balta after finishing school and was accepted to the Karabalta Medical College in 1995 with a major of a nurse-midwife.  Gulnara finished college with a red diploma (degree with distinction) in 1998 and found work as a nurse in a maternity hospital.  She married Aybek, who worked as a security guard at a distillery, in 1999 and gave birth to a son that same year.  In 2000, Gulnara and her family moved to the Poltavka village, where her husband found a job, and in 2009, they had their youngest daughter.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Gulnara started breeding livestock in 2010 and bought a cow as a start and with a goal of making a profit from sales of milk and sour-cream.  Gulnara requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows and fodder in order to expand her business.  In the future, Gulnara dreams of building a big house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice, cooking oil and utensils for her café.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with one child 17 years old living in Hoima, Uganda.  She has dependents, and her spouse also earns an income for the family.
 
She has been operating a fresh foods business for the past 11 years. However, she still has a challenge of price fluctuations. She hopes her business will grow bigger in the future. 

Jane intends to use the loan to purchase fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase  fresh foods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 35 years old, married, with 3 children aged 7-19 years. She has other dependents and her spouse also earns some income. The couple lives in their own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 14 years, Grace has been diligently running a fresh foods business. She started with selling green vegetables but now she has a variety of fresh foods she is selling. She hopes her business will grow so that she can start a retail shop. Grace needs a loan to buy fresh foods for sale.

loans.use: to pay for fresh foods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and together the couple has 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda. Sarah was dealing in vegetables formerly but now she has diversified her business to include farming. Sarah is venturing in maize, cassava and banana growing. However, she faces a challenge with seasonal weather changes. In the future, she hopes to diversify her business and include other business too. Sarah intends to use the loan to grow maize.

loans.use: to grow maize

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while the other one is too young for school. Her husband who is a farmer contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Teresia has operated a rope-selling business for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transporting her products from the market to her place of sale. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 5,000 she wants to purchase more stock of ropes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of ropes for resale.
